content: In a major cross-border trademark infringement case, Delhi high court granted an injunction in favor of Amul, India's largest dairy brand, against Italian company Terre Primitive. The Italian firm had been selling cookies and chocolate-covered biscuits under the mark " Amuleti ," which closely resembled Amul 's well-known trademark. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation, which markets dairy products under brand name Amul, filed the suit through counsel Abhishek Singh, who argued that Amul, a household name in India, had a global reputation, ranking 8th among the world's top dairy organisations. Singh contended that Terre Primitive had "blatantly" copied the script, style, and manner in which "Amul" was represented simply by adding the word "eti" to the mark. Justice Mini Pushkarna passed the injunction order restraining the Italian firm from using or dealing with any marks identical to "Amul" and directed them to remove infringing products from their website. Meta Inc. was ordered to block or delete the Italian firm's social media accounts promoting the said products. Jayen Mehta, the managing director of Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation, called the order a relief for Amul and a precedent for protecting indigenous brands from foreign infringement. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Big bettors are throwing tricky questions at WazirX, the cryptocurrency exchange which is knocking on the doors of Singapore insolvency court after a crippling crypto heist. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Two of the largest corporate users, which had purchased cryptos worth millions of dollars on the WazirX platform, have questioned why they are described as contingent creditors of a Singapore company in the court papers when their dealings have been with WazirX which is owned by an Indian entity . Most investors in India were unaware of Zettai before the cyberattack that drove the company to Singapore court to seek a moratorium. It emerged that Zettai is the parent of the Indian company Zanmai which launched the WazirX platform. However, the two investors - Bitcipher Labs and NextGenDev - have asserted that their "legal relationships are with Zanmai and not Zettai". In a letter to the Singapore court, CHP Law , a firm representing these investors, said, "Our clients are uncertain from their reading of NS1A why Zettai SG considers them to be creditors of Zettai SG. Zettai SG has also not communicated with them about this." Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program According to the affidavit, Zettai took control, "under protest", of the cryptocurrency tokens from its partner Binance following a rift between the two. The dispute is currently in the midst of arbitration proceedings in Singapore whose deliberations are confidential. In the letter before the court, CHP, on behalf of Bitcipher and NextGenDev, said that no documents have been disclosed to show how the transfer of control and/or ownership of the tokens between the parties occurred. "Further, it is not clear which is the specific entity/person who is presently holding the tokens belonging to WazirX's users, in particular, the specific tokens belonging to our clients. Clarity needs to be provided as to which tokens Binance, Zettai SG and Zanmai India respectively hold and/or control," they said. The letter, outlining the objections of the two investors, was attached to a supplementary affidavit filed by Shetty on September 10. The first affidavit was filed in end-August. With multiple offshore crypto platforms approaching Indian authorities to do business here, the WazirX development is being closely tracked by some of the practitioners of tax and foreign exchange laws. According to Harshal Bhuta, partner at the CA firm PR Bhuta & Co, the recent revelation that Zanmai India did not actually hold custody of cryptocurrencies complicates matters for Indian users of the platform. "As a consequence, if it is construed that users' cryptocurrencies are held in custody wallets outside India, then it may expose the Indian users to complications under the Foreign Exchange Management Act , where there is uncertainty regarding the regulations for purchase of cryptocurrencies held outside India. Additionally, Indian users may need to report these cryptocurrencies as foreign assets in their tax returns under Schedule FA, failing which they may face penalties under Black Money law," said Bhuta. It appears that Zanmai India operated rupee-related services on the platform, while Binance operated the rest. Referring to this, the letter said, "It is not clear what the term 'operating' means. No documents have been disclosed to elaborate on what this means. In particular, our clients are interested to know if 'operating' means that Zanmai India held and/or controlled all tokens belonging to INR-related matters, including all transactions involving our clients." A cyberattack in July 2024 saw one of the platform's wallets emptied of $234 million in funds. But it is unclear which specific wallet was emptied and which of WazirX's users' funds were held in that wallet, said the two platform users. And more importantly, whether their tokens were held in the hacked wallet. These investors have also questioned the jurisdiction of the Singapore court in a dispute between them and Zanmai. Such questions thrown up in the wake of the WazirX fiasco have once again underscored the ambiguities around cryptocurrency transactions in India. While there is no legal ban on crypto trades and all deals and gains are heavily taxed, local users may still be clueless about how and where the virtual digital assets they have been betting on are housed and whether they have unwittingly broken any law. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: A host of allegations swirling around Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch have raised doubts about the market regulator's credibility and integrity. But her silence on mounting allegations by the Congress and other could be making things worse for her. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} American short seller Hindenburg Research last month published a report accusing the Sebi chief of conflict of interest and alleged that she and her husband Dhaval Buch had stakes in obscure offshore entities. The report was followed by the Congress making several allegations against her over weeks. Today, Hindenburg wrote on X, "Buch has maintained her complete silence for weeks on all of the emerging issues." Right after Hindenburg published its report targeting her and her husband, they released a statement clarifying the allegations. But since then, she has observed complete silence, though the private companies that figured in the allegations against her have issued clarifications. Also Read: Sebi needs stricter controls amid charges against Madhabi Puri Will the probe do the talking? Nearly a week ago, ET had reported based on information from sources that the parliamentary Public Accounts Committee was set to look into allegations against the Sebi chief and may summon her later this month. The matter was added to the PAC's agenda after several members demanded an inquiry into the functioning of Sebi and allegations against Buch at the panel's first meeting on August 29, ET reported. The PAC is headed by Congress leader KC Venugopal and has members from both the ruling NDA and the opposition INDIA bloc. Dr. C.P. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program However, it seems the probe by PAC is still not a settled issue. It has become a bone of contention between the MPs of ruling and opposition side in the panel, ET reported yesterday. Also Read: Madhabi Buch maintained complete silence for weeks: Hindenburg TMC Sougata Roy demanded that Buch should depose before the PAC to discuss the functioning of SEBI, as per ET's source-based report. Roy made this demand at a meeting convened to take up the performance audit of Jal Jeevan Mission. The TMC also wrote a letter to PAC Chairperson KC Venugopal requesting to call SEBI chairperson as it is a matter of public interest, sources told ET. BJP leader Nishikant Dubey, strongly objected to the demand saying it was against rules. Dubey also added that CAG principal auditor cannot audit Sebi without the mandate of the central government, hence the PAC too cannot summon officials of regulators without evidence of "flaws" in finances provided by the government. Dubey is learnt to have said that the PAC being the oldest parliamentary panel has its sets of defined rules and if a suo motu cognisance has to be taken, it has to be substantiated with evidence. In the absence of a formal probe so far, Madhabi Puri Buch's silence on mounting allegations against her is making her situation more untenable. Her silence is likely to only embolden her detractors and give weight to the allegations. How Buch landed into a whirlpool of trouble Ever since Hindenburg published a report accusing Madhabi Puri Buch of conflict of interest nearly a month ago, allegations have been coming thick and fast against her. By now, there are complaints against the IIM-Ahmedabad alumnus from four different quarters - international , domestic , internal as well as political . As soon as the controversy surrounding fresh claims by Hindenburg died down following detailed clarifications by all parties, Congress jumped in. Party spokesperson Pawan Khera alleged that Buch continued to draw a salary from ICICI Bank while she was a member of SEBI, which, according to him, represents a serious breach of ethics and accountability in public service. While this time neither Sebi nor Buch issued any official statement, ICICI Bank made it clear that she wasn't paid any salary or ESOPs after superannuation in October 2013, other than retiral benefits. Soon after, Zee group patriarch Subhash Chandra levelled several allegations against the Sebi chief and even called her "corrupt". "This was the main reason for the merger to set apart, and that is why I am questioning today that Sebi is supposed to protect the interest of minority shareholders, and she succeeded in pushing away Sony from getting merged with Zee," he alleged. Bush also faced allegations from her own employees. It came to light recently that Sebi officials made an unprecedented complaint to the finance ministry last month, accusing her of fostering a toxic work culture. "Shouting, scolding and public humiliation have become a norm in meetings," said the August 6 letter, which ET had reviewed. Hundreds of Sebi officers protested last week at the headquarters of the capital markets regulator in Mumbai, demanding the resignation of Buch while also seeking withdrawal of Sebi's media statement that described their letter to the Centre as a likely fallout of instigation by unidentified ‘external elements’. Sebi said employees, who were demanding a 55% hike in HRA, twisted the narrative to make it a "work culture" issue after their earlier protest yielded no result. The Congress did not stop at accusing Buch of receiving payments from ICICI Bank. Congress spokesperson Khera alleged that Buch and her husband own a property in Mumbai, which was given on rent to a company called Carol Info Services Ltd, and is a part of Wockhardt Ltd. , a firm that has been investigated by Sebi for multiple cases. However, Wockhardt denied conflict of interest and corruption allegations made by the Congress. Yesterday, the Congress in a "shocking" set of "revelations" alleged that Buch and her husband earned crores of rupees from six listed companies including Mahindra and Mahindra . Congress said that contrary to her claim that an advisory company owned by her became dormant when she took office, Agora Private Limited continued to provide services and generated revenue of Rs 2.95 crore between 2016-2024. The Congress claimed that Agora clients include Mahindra and Mahindra Limited, Dr. Reddy’s, Pidilite , ICICI, Sembcorp, Visu Leasing & Finance. "Strangely, of the total Rs 2.95 Crores received by Agora Advisory Private Limited, 2.59 Crores has come from one entity alone - the Mahindra & Mahindra Group. It accounts for 88 per cent of the total money that Agora Advisory received," it alleged. However, Mahindra called allegations levied by Congress against the auto major and the Sebi chief "false and misleading in nature". It said the allegations suggest a conflict of interest on payments made to Dhaval Buch, husband of Madhabi Buch. Mahidnra clarified that Dhaval Buch was hired in 2019 specifically for his expertise in supply chain and sourcing, soon after he retired as Unilever's Global Chief Procurement Officer. He has spent most of his time at Bristlecone, a subsidiary which is a supply chain consulting company and is currently on the Board of Bristlecone. He joined Mahindra Group almost three years before Madhabi Puri Buch was appointed as SEBI Chairperson, the company clarified. Compensation has been specifically and only for Buch’s supply chain expertise and management acumen, based on his global experience at Unilever, the company said. Dr Reddy's Laboratories too issued a clarification on the allegations levelled by the Congress, terming them "baseless and malafide", saying that Dhaval Buch's assignment with the company "started and ended well before Ms Madhabi Buch’s term as SEBI Chairperson". Should Buch speak or not? Though the allegations have been denied by involved companies, Buch's silence on the allegations only gives strength to her detractors. However, her response to each and every allegations might drag her deeper into the mess. Industrialist Harsh Goenka, who came out in Buch's support last week, said she may have made some enemies because of not being diplomatic enough. "It's disheartening to see Madhabi Puri Buch, head of SEBI, being cornered despite her strong moral values and integrity. Diplomacy may not be her strength, and it seems she's made some enemies because of it. However, I'm confident she'll rise above it all and come out stronger," Goenka had written on X. An undergraduate in mathematics from Delhi's St. Stephens College, Buch held various roles at ICICI Bank and was also the CEO of ICICI Securities from 2009 to 2011. After joining the watchdog as its whole-time member from 2017 to 2021, she was appointed as the Chairperson in March 2022. Her 3-year-term ends in March 2025. A group of the Sebi chief's IIM Ahmedabad classmates have banded together to support her. A letter being circulated on social media aims to clear allegations against Buch. “What is happening today in the public space in terms of mud-slinging against a senior functionary of a democratic institution of the country, is unfortunate. If we, with just a little bit of effort on fact check could determine all of this, is it not sad that even this much effort is not being taken before sullying a person's reputation? We are continuing our fact-checks on other questions that have been raised and will share our findings with you as we get them," it said. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}
title: Regulator in cross hairs: Is Madhavi Puri Buch's silence muddying the waters? - The Economic Times

content: As the Adani-Hindenburg saga continues to simmer, the US short seller claimed late Thursday that Swiss authorities have frozen more than $310 million in funds across Swiss bank accounts as part of an investigation into allegations of money laundering and securities forgery linked to the Adani Group, dating back as early as 2021, citing newly released Swiss criminal court records. However, the Adani Group has firmly rejected and denied the "baseless allegations" presented in the Hindenburg post. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} In their response, the Adani Group reiterated that their overseas holding structure is transparent, fully disclosed, and compliant with all relevant laws. They also clarified that they are not involved in any Swiss court proceedings, emphasizing that neither their group companies were mentioned in any such court documents nor have they received any requests for clarification. A Swiss twist in the Adani-Hindenburg saga In a post on X on Thursday, the US short-seller said that the probe, which dates back to 2021, has shed light on financial practices involving opaque offshore entities tied to the Indian conglomerate. Swiss criminal court records show in detail how an Adani frontman invested in opaque BVI/Mauritius & Bermuda funds that almost exclusively owned Adani stock, the U.S.-based short seller said in a post on X, formerly Twitter, citing a Swiss media outlet. — HindenburgRes As per a report by Swiss media, Geneva Public Prosecutor's Office was investigating alleged wrongdoing by the Indian conglomerate Adani well before activist investors from Hindenburg Research made the first accusations. Adani Group vehemently rejected the allegations saying, "We unequivocally reject and deny the baseless allegations presented. The Adani Group has no involvement in any Swiss court proceedings, nor have any of our company accounts been subject to sequestration by any authority." It went on to say that "even in the alleged order, the Swiss court has neither mentioned our group companies, nor have we received any requests for clarification or information from any such authority or regulatory body. We reiterate that our overseas holding structure is transparent, fully disclosed, and compliant with all relevant laws." The allegations, it said, "are clearly preposterous, irrational, and absurd. We have no hesitation in stating that this is yet another orchestrated and egregious attempt by the same cohorts acting in unison to inflict irreversible damage on our group's reputation and market value." You Might Also Like: Hindenburg questions SEBI chief's silence on fresh charges "The Adani Group remains steadfastly committed to transparency and compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements," it said, adding it "strongly condemns" the allegations." Hindenburg-Sebi showdown Hindenburg, which had accused the Adani Group of using tax havens to circumvent local market regulations back in January 2023, recently alleged that the Securities and Exchange Board of India chairperson, Madhabi Buch, might be influencing the slow investigation into the conglomerate due to her past investments and dealings. Both Buch and the Adani Group have denied these recent allegations. Meanwhile, the opposition Congress party has intensified its scrutiny of Buch, accusing her of holding 99 percent of the shares in a company still actively providing advisory and consultancy services, and alleging that her husband, Dhaval Buch, has earned income from companies under her adjudication. You Might Also Like: Madhabi Buch maintained complete silence for weeks: Hindenburg on Congress' allegations against SEBI chief Hindenburg alleged she had a conflict of interest in the Adani matter because of a previous investment in an offshore fund used by the Adani Group. Buch countered saying the investments pre-date her term at SEBI and that all necessary disclosures were made. She termed Hindenburg's allegations as an attempt at "character assassination" following the regulator's enforcement action and "show cause" notice to the U.S. based shortseller for violating Indian rules. A show cause notice signals an intention to take disciplinary action if satisfactory explanations are not provided. Buch was appointed to the top post at SEBI in March 2022 after spending five years as a whole-time member, the second highest position at the regulator. She completes her three-year term in March next year. The First Hindenburg attack on Adani Hindenburg in its first attack in Jan 24, 2023, said that Adani Group has been involved in extensive stock manipulation and accounting fraud for decades, with an estimated $218 billion involved. The Group's key companies have taken on significant debt, with five out of seven having reported low current ratios, indicating severe liquidity issues. As per the initial allegations, the Adani Group has faced four major government fraud investigations for money laundering, theft, and corruption, totaling about $17 billion. The Hindenburg report claimed that Vinod Adani, Gautam Adani's elder brother, being linked to numerous offshore shell entities in tax havens, including Mauritius and the Caribbean, which are used for stock manipulation and money laundering. As per the first Hindenburg report, evidence suggested that Adani companies have been involved in stock parking and manipulative trading, with offshore entities controlling large portions of Adani stock and affecting market stability. The US-based short seller also claimed that Adani's independent auditor is a small firm with limited capacity, raising questions about the thoroughness and reliability of financial audits. It added, despite ongoing investigations by SEBI, the Indian securities regulator, enforcement actions have been minimal, allowing the Adani Group to continue its alleged fraudulent activities. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Scaling up new businesses and technologies, Shell is shaping the future of energy through collaboration and innovation, celebrating remarkable ideas to steer innovation. Shell India hosted the second edition of its flagship event, ‘Changemakers of Tomorrow 2024’, in Bengaluru on September 9. Key experts, industry leaders, and innovators convened at the day-long event to engage, collaborate, and design unique solutions geared to shape the future of energy. Madhu Bangarappa, Minister for Primary & Secondary Education, Government of Karnataka and Gaurav Gupta , Additional Chief Secretary, Energy and Water Resources, Government of Karnataka inaugurated the event. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} “It is inspiring to experience an event like Changemakers of Tomorrow, which brings together the brilliance and creativity of young minds, industry leaders, and innovators. Shell’s commitment to nurturing talent is commendable and as Karnataka strives to become a hub for knowledge and technological advancements, such initiatives will equip the youth with the mindset and skills necessary to create a more resilient energy future”, said Madhu Bangarappa. Mansi Madan Tripathy, Chairperson, Shell Group of Companies in India, said, "As we witness the remarkable response to Changemakers of Tomorrow, it is clear that India’s youth is not just dreaming of a sustainable energy future, but actively engineering it. This event spotlights the extraordinary potential and ingenuity of our next generation, which is poised to redefine the energy landscape in India. At Shell, our goal is to equip these innovators with the tools, knowledge, and support to drive transformative change. With this event, we are turning our vision into reality, ensuring a balanced transition to meet today’s energy needs while building the energy system of the future through technological innovations.” The event showcased Shell’s flagship initiatives such as Shell's NXplorers programme featuring school students, Shell E4 incubated startups, and pioneering ideas in the space of low-carbon technologies and energy storage. It also included masterclasses and engaging sessions organised by Shell’s partners Wipro, Microsoft, Accenture, Infosys, HP, and Tata Consultancy Services, highlighting the power of partnerships and digital innovation to transform the energy landscape. In addition, the event showcased innovative solutions such as next-generation data-centre cooling with Shell immersion cooling fluids, Shell Recharge, and others. “We are proud to see Bengaluru, the heart of our state's innovation and technology sector, hosting such a significant event. India’s energy landscape is evolving rapidly, and the transition to a sustainable and resilient energy future is paramount for our nation’s growth. With platforms like Changemakers of Tomorrow that support young entrepreneurs and foster industry collaborations and dialogues, Shell is creating a dynamic ecosystem poised to accelerate India’s transition to a low-carbon economy ,” said Gaurav Gupta. content: Mahindra on Tuesday called allegations levied by Congress against the auto major and Securities and Exchange Board of India chief Madhabi Puri Buch , " false and misleading in nature." #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} "We categorically state that we have not, at any point, requested SEBI for any preferential treatment. We maintain the highest standards of corporate governance," said the company in a statement. There are several allegations made by a political party today which was covered by several news agencies, said the automaker. "The allegations suggest a conflict of interest on payments made to Dhaval Buch, husband of Madhabi Buch." Issuing a clarification, M&M said: Mahindra Group hired Dhaval Buch in 2019 specifically for his expertise in supply chain and sourcing, soon after he retired as Unilever's Global Chief Procurement Officer. He has spent most of his time at Bristlecone, a subsidiary which is a supply chain consulting company. Mr. Buch is currently on the Board of Bristlecone. He joined Mahindra Group almost 3 years before Madhabi Puri Buch was appointed as SEBI Chairperson. Compensation has been specifically and only for Mr. Buch’s supply chain expertise and management acumen, based on his global experience at Unilever. None of the 5 SEBI orders or approvals referenced in the allegations are relevant. Details are: Three out of the five approvals or orders of SEBI do not pertain to the Company or any of its subsidiaries. One was a fast-track rights issue, which did not require any approval from SEBI. One was an order issued in Mar 2018, well before Dhaval started working with the Mahindra Group. content: Jaimin Gupta , the founder of men's fashion brand Barcelona , along with other investors have acquired a majority stake in Gujarat based Aarvee Denims and Exports . #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Last week, Aarvee said it has approved the execution of the share purchase agreement for selling 1.42 crore shares to Jaimin Gupta along with Tarachand Agrawal and Qmin Industries The deal also triggered an obligation on the acquirers to make an open offer to the public shareholders of the company to acquire additional stake. "The open offer is being made by the acquirer along with the Person Acting in Concert for acquisition of up to 60.99 lakhs shares, constituting 26% ol the equity share capital of the target company, at a price of Rs41 per share," it said in a BSE filing. Aarvee Denims and Exports, a debt ridden firm, has an production capacity of 85 million meters per annum and had sales of Rs91.33 crore in FY24, a significant decline from Rs751.56 crore in FY19. Barcelona, a men’s fashion and apparel brand, was founded in 2015 by Gupta, who has now acquired a 45% stake. Stitched Textiles Private Limited owns Barcelona that has over 125 franchise stores apart from its B2B app where the stock is sold wholesale to apparel retailers. The company has a monthly manufacturing capacity of 1.2 Million fabrics for suiting and shirting and 2.2 lakh garments manufacturing capacity in men’s wear. Overall retail sales growth rate in India across segments such as apparel, footwear and quick service restaurants slowed to 4-7% year-on-year every month in FY24, reflecting comparatively weaker consumer sentiment. In her new role, she will lead efforts to strengthen learning , innovation, and inclusivity, the statement said. “As we embark on a new phase of growth and innovation, our focus remains on fostering a culture that drives ambition and alignment throughout the organisation. Under Pawan Bhageria’s leadership, we have established a solid foundation, and with Geena's appointment, we are confident that our people strategy will be perfectly aligned with the next stage of our growth," said Warren Harris , CEO and managing director of Tata Technologies. Binoy has over 30 years of experience in the manufacturing and technology sector. content: Ignoring the credibility crisis at the very top of the Securities and Exchange Board of India won’t make it go away. Nor will chair Madhabi Puri Buch’s decision to stop answering questions about her potential conflict of interest prevent the opposition Congress Party or Hindenburg Research from asking them. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Buch, the first SEBI chief from the private sector, is yet to respond to the opposition party's repeated questioning of her income sources, though she was quick to deny the short seller’s criticism of her past investments. Also Read: Madhabi Buch maintained complete silence for weeks: Hindenburg Investments weren’t really a problem for her predecessors. They might have dabbled in stocks on their modest civil-servant salaries, but income from wealth was unlikely to have taken up much space in their tax filings. Unlike Buch, they didn’t own a consulting firm or have access to a segregated account in an offshore fund — two of the points in Hindenburg’s Aug. 10 report that questioned her objectivity. These gentlemen had government pensions, but no employee stock options from a regulated entity — an issue the Congress has made much of. It will be a pity if the media glare on Buch prompts New Delhi to revert to reserving top regulatory jobs for retired or retiring civil servants. They covet these plum sinecures. But restricting the field could deprive institutions of talented outsiders who are genuinely interested in public service. Besides, government insiders don’t have a lock on perceptions of probity: Past SEBI chiefs have also attracted criticism, though usually for the directorships they accepted after leaving office. What needs an update is the code of service. With adequate financial controls, it may be possible for the right candidate to avoid being in the limelight for the wrong reason. Dr. C.P. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program Also Read: Madhabi Puri via Agora earned crores from M&M, ICICI, Dr. Reddy's & 3 other listed cos: Congress Buch’s silence after her response to Hindenburg’s allegations has added to the confusion. A media mogul, who’s being investigated by the market watchdog for allegedly siphoning funds from his company, has joined the melee and accused her of thwarting the sale of his beleaguered business. Some disgruntled officers have complained of a “toxic work culture” under Buch’s leadership. After the regulator denied those allegations in a five-page press release, some 200 employees staged a silent protest in the SEBI’s Mumbai campus last week. Media reports suggest that parliament’s bipartisan public accounts committee could take up a probe into SEBI. However, it’s unclear if the panel will have the authority to question the chair about her personal finances, given the absence of an official document as its reference point. After the Hindenburg report, Buch said that she disclosed all her interests, and followed a strict recusal policy. But the government that gave her the job may have needed to do more. At the minimum, she should have been asked to put her financial assets into a blind trust, where there’s minimal communication between her and the temporary overseer of her wealth. Also Read: Who is behind Hindenburg Research and what is their allegation on Madhabi Puri Buch There is no such rule. The SEBI’s policy on conflict of interest for board members does not ban trading, except on the basis of unpublished price-sensitive information. The organization’s terms of service merely state that the chairman will not have any financial interests that are “likely to affect prejudicially his functions.” To see how a blind trust might have helped operationalize this, consider a specific allegation. The Congress Party has asked Buch to explain how she kept receiving income from ICICI Bank Ltd., her past employer, even after becoming a full-time member of the regulatory body in 2017 and its chair in 2022. Although Buch didn’t reply, ICICI said the income consisted of superannuation benefits following her 2013 retirement from the bank and gains from stock options awarded to her while she was employed. Since Buch had a 10-year-long period in which she could convert the options, the government needed to ask itself what would be appropriate for the top markets regulator: a “qualified” blind trust or a stricter version? In the former, Buch would exercise her options and place her ICICI stock in the trust before joining the SEBI; in the latter, she would also sell the shares and park the proceeds with the manager. Still, even qualified blind trusts have been hard to enforce among lawmakers in Washington. Also Read: Mounting worries for Madhabi Buch: Sebi officials flag ‘toxic’ work culture The Indian Supreme Court had appointed a committee after Hindenburg’s original short-seller report on the Adani Group cratered the conglomerate’s market value and kept it depressed for most of 2023. The panel said it lacked the evidence to return a finding of regulatory failure on the SEBI’s part. I have previously argued that the same experts should be asked to consider Hindenburg’s new report targeting Buch. However, now that the Congress has questioned her relationship with ICICI, the composition will have to change. K.V. Kamath, one of the committee’s six members, was the CEO of the bank for a part of Buch’s career there. Any inquiry must be more than a postmortem. India needs concrete suggestions on how situations of potential conflict can be prevented from arising in the first place. By hurling allegations in dribs and drabs, lawmakers opposed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi might keep this issue alive until parliament reconvenes in late November or early December. Their goal is to paint a picture of institutional decay and rampant crony capitalism under Modi’s decade-long control on power; the current crisis is just a backdrop. Its resolution in a way that will restore the SEBI’s credibility will be a welcome change for the Indian markets. But I’m not holding my breath. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: A number of Indian companies were featured on TIME 's World's Best Companies of 2024 list among which are HCLTech , Infosys , Wipro , the Adani Group and Reliance Industries . The list consists of 1000 companies among which 22 this year are Indian-born. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The highest ranking company among the top 15 Indian firms to be listed was HCLTech at 112, followed by Infosys and Wipro at 119 and 134, respectively. While the Adani group ranked at 736, Mukesh Ambani owned Reliance Industries ranked higher at 646 on TIME magazine's list The other notable Indian companies that found spots on the list are Mahindra Group at 187, Larsen & Toubro at 549, ITC Limited at 586, and Hero MotoCorp at 597. A number of banking firms also ranked rather well in the list among which Axis Bank topped with 504, followed by Centre-owned State Bank of India with 518; while third and fourth spots went to ICICI Bank at 525, and Kotak Mahindra Bank at 551. Additionally, Yes Bank also took up a spot at 783. Employee satisfaction was assessed through surveys conducted in over 50 countries with around 170,000 participants, evaluating companies on factors such as recommendations, work conditions, salary, equality, and overall company image. content: ManipalCigna Health Insurance , a joint venture between Manipal Group and Cigna Healthcare , has appointed Richa Chatterjee its new chief human resources officer, effective September 2, 2024. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Chatterjee, who comes with over two decades of experience, will be responsible for overseeing the company's HR strategies, focusing on attracting, developing, and retaining top talent. Her responsibilities will include driving ManipalCigna’s people agenda, fostering a culture of diversity and inclusivity, and aligning HR practices to drive organisational growth. Prasun Sikdar , Managing Director and CEO, ManipalCigna Health Insurance, said in a statement: “I am confident Richa’s expertise will enable us to lead our DEI efforts, attract and retain the talent necessary and continue to deliver on our company's purpose and growth strategy.” “My focus will be on enhancing our people strategy, fostering a culture that empowers and inspires our employees and propels us forward as an organisation towards our mission,” Chatterjee said. Prior to joining, ManipalCigna, Chatterjee held the role of CHRO and President at Indian Infoline Group. Earlier in her career, she has worked in various capacities within the HR domain across oganisations including The Boston Consulting Group and Tata Motors . content: PM Narendra Modi will issue sanction letters to a million beneficiaries of the rural housing scheme on September 17 and digitally transfer ₹ 3,180 crore as the first instalment for the construction of the houses, rural development and agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Friday. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} At a ceremony in Odisha on September 17, the PM will also unveil the 'Awas + 2024' app, Chouhan told media persons. The app is designed to help in the allotment of houses to intended beneficiaries under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin . Before that, the PM will distribute sanction letters to around 20,000 beneficiaries of Jharkhand on September 15. In this financial year, 113,195 houses are planned to be built in Jharkhand under the PMAY-G and ₹187.79 crore has been released for the purpose. On September 16, the PM will visit Gujarat where more than 650,000 houses have been constructed under the scheme over the past ten years, Chouhan said. Under the scheme, 54,135 houses are to be built in the state in this fiscal, for which ₹99.1 crore has been released. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Blackstone Inc. is considering options including a sale of its majority stake in visa outsourcing and technology services firm VFS Global after receiving interest from prospective investors, people familiar with the matter said. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The US alternative asset manager has held preliminary discussions with advisers to evaluate a full or partial stake sale in VFS, the people said, asking not to be identified because the matter is private. A potential transaction could value VFS at about $7 billion, the people said. One of the options could include bringing in a minority investor to help raise cash and boost growth, the people said. Firms including sovereign wealth funds have shown interest in investing in the asset, the people said. Considerations are at an early stage and Blackstone may still decide against pursuing a deal, they said. A representative for Blackstone declined to comment. The Finance Ministry said in a statement, "As part of a broader initiative to streamline and rationalise existing rules and regulations to further facilitate ease of doing business, the compounding proceeding rules were comprehensively reviewed in consultation with the Reserve Bank of India." The new rule will replace the existing Foreign Exchange Rules 2000. The ministry said that the government is emphasising simplifying the provisions to expedite and streamline the processing of compounding applications. "These amendments indicate the commitment of the government towards promoting 'ease of investment' for investors and 'ease of doing business' for businesses," the ministry said. The Compounding of Foreign Exchange Proceedings Rules, 2000 govern the process of resolving or settling offences related to violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act , 1999. Compounding under these rules allows individuals or entities to admit a violation and pay a penalty to avoid protracted litigation or criminal prosecution. The move was taken after Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sithraman emphasised that the government would prioritise foreign investment in the country and that it would come up with flexible rules to promote foreign investments. The finance minister has indicated in her budget speech that the rules and regulations for FDIs and overseas Investments will be simplified to facilitate foreign direct investments, nudge prioritisation, and promote opportunities for using Indian Rupee as a currency for overseas investments. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: LIDE, the largest business leaders organisation in Latin America , has opened its first office in India . LIDE, who represent over 2,000 large cap member companies globally have a business network spanning 34 economic sectors. Founded in Brazil in 2003, LIDE’s objectives are to promote dialogue, collaboration, bi-lateral partnerships and responsible economic growth for business leaders across private and public sectors. With international offices in more than 20 countries, the office, which is in Mumbai , becomes LIDE’s 43rd global office. The office will not only aim to strengthen trade relations between Brazil and India but also serve as a bridge for Indian companies and organizations to explore new markets where LIDE is already present. The office will look to prioritize sectors such as agribusiness, technology, infrastructure, energy and innovation. Currently, Brazil is India’s largest trading partner in Latin America, with bilateral trade reaching nearly USD 12 billion in 2023. Speaking on the opening of its first office in India, João Doria, Founder and Co-chairman of LIDE said, “The arrival of LIDE in India accelerates opportunities for new business between India and Brazil and enhances economic and institutional relations between these two great nations. Our aim is to provide a platform for natural interactions in a neutral environment for private as well as public sector players. There is enormous potential for both countries as India is expected to be one of the top three global economies by 2030 thus creating ample opportunities for bilateral trade growth. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: The recent presidential debate brought tariffs into the spotlight, revealing sharp contrasts between the economic strategies of former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Tariffs—taxes imposed on imported goods—are a contentious issue, with each candidate proposing different approaches that could significantly impact American consumers and businesses. Trump’s Tariff Proposal Donald Trump, the GOP nominee, has reiterated his commitment to a robust tariff policy. His proposal includes a 10% tariff on all imported goods and a staggering 60% tariff on imports from China. During the debate, Trump claimed that these tariffs would compel other countries to "pay us back" and could generate “hundreds of billions of dollars” in revenue, as mentioned in a report by NBC. The pro-business Tax Foundation estimates that Trump's tariffs could potentially raise up to $2.5 trillion over a decade. However, this revenue may only cover a portion of the tax breaks and spending initiatives proposed by Trump. Harris’s Approach In contrast, Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee, has criticized tariffs as a form of “sales tax” that ultimately burdens American households. The Biden administration has already extended some of the tariffs imposed during Trump’s tenure, focusing on goods like steel, aluminum, and technology components. While Harris has not explicitly stated her stance on extending these tariffs, her campaign emphasizes supporting American industries and addressing unfair trade practices, as per the NBC report. Harris’s plan includes tax breaks for middle-class Americans and higher taxes on wealthier individuals to bolster economic growth and reduce the deficit. The goal is to balance revenue generation and economic fairness without disproportionately affecting consumers. Also Read : U.S Elections: Who is Laura Loomer, far-right activist, who is influencing Donald Trump in his campaign Economic Implications of Tariffs Tariffs come with significant trade-offs. While they can protect domestic industries and promote job creation, they often result in higher prices for consumers. For example, the Trump administration’s 2018 tariffs on washing machines led to an increase in prices by up to 10%, despite creating over 2,000 jobs in the U.S. The cost of these jobs was estimated at $815,000 per position, highlighting the complex impact of tariffs. Economists generally agree that tariffs can support domestic industries but can also impose higher costs on the economy. A 2018 interview with trade historian Douglas Irwin emphasized that while tariffs might benefit certain sectors, they can also result in higher costs and reduced overall economic efficiency. Biden’s Tariff Continuation and Broader Economic Effects The Biden administration’s approach to tariffs includes extending those initiated by Trump and introducing new ones. In May, Biden announced tariffs on steel, aluminum, and critical technology components. The rationale behind these tariffs mirrors that of the Trump administration: addressing unfair trade practices and supporting American workers. However, economists warn that tariffs can create significant economic challenges, such as lower purchasing power and increased business uncertainty. The Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget suggests that Trump’s proposed 60% tariff on Chinese imports could have mixed results, potentially generating substantial revenue but also leading to economic disruption. FAQs When will the US elections be held? The polls will be conducted on November 4, 2024. Will there be another Presidential debate between Trump and Harris? Here are some of the major instances of companies' Indian operations being disrupted by labour-related woes since the turn of the decade: Oct. 2023: Workers of General Motors India staged protests after the plant in western Maharashtra state was acquired by Hyundai Motor India , leading to a halt in production for five days, media reported. The workers wanted Hyundai to absorb them. Dec. 2021 - Jan. 2022: Foxconn, which makes chargers for Apple, shuttered a factory for over three weeks in southern Tamil Nadu state due to protests over workers falling sick with food poisoning. Ford stopped work for two days, while the other two suspended operations for five days each. Dec. 2020 - Feb. 2021: Another Apple supplier Wistron Corp's factory in Karnataka was shut for two months after contract workers angry over unpaid wages destroyed property, equipment and iPhones . Nov. 2020 - Dec. 2020: For roughly two months, Toyota Motor Corp sporadically halted operations at its manufacturing plant in Karnataka amid protests against the suspension of a worker. Nov. 2019: Protests at Honda Motorcycle and Scooter India's plant in Haryana led to the facility being closed for 18 days, per media reports. Protesters said several workers had been forced to go on indefinite leave. content: There are strong concerns about the arrival of a recession in the United States, and the Federal Reserve is trying their best to halt it for as long as possible. Reports suggest that they have gone to the extent of planning an interest rate cut of 50 basis points for stopping the impending recession in its tracks. However, there are multiple other market factors in play, which could bring in a recession or an economic downturn, and the upcoming US elections 2024 could also be one of them. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} What could be the effects of a 50 bps rate cut? A 50 bps rate cut could somehow ease the pressure off of US investors, but it may also bring in certain volatility factors into play in the US markets, suggest a few market experts. Some are suggesting that a 25 bps rate cut would suffice for now, and would not trouble the market scenario, amid the ongoing drama surrounding the US Presidential polls 2024, as well as the September troubles of a few renowned stocks, including the likes of Nvidia, Nasdaq 100 , S&P 500 and more. Should you buy or sell as an US investor amid this crisis market scenario? A US investor should consider all market forces in play at this very moment, including the fact that September is not a very good month for most stocks, especially during any election season in the United States. Therefore, some may consider waiting out this volatile period and hold positions until things are on a optimistic trajectory. Meanwhile, others can consider buying certain stocks that ae dipping heavily this September, including S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100. FAQs: Should one buy Nasdaq 100 now? Nasdaq 100 is obviously a very popular stock to purchase, looking at its optimum returns across years, and also with the fact that it is dipping this September, making it the perfect opportunity. Will S&P 500 continue a downward trend in September? The S&P 500, according to market legend, always follows a downward trajectory in the month of September. content: Jay Blades rose to fame in television in 2017 with the debut of The Repair Shop. The host of the BBC show The Repair Shop , Jay Blades, has been accused of abusing his controlling and coercive relationship with his estranged wife. The host made an appearance at Kidderminster Magistrates' Court on Friday to answer a single charge. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} West Mercia Police stated that following a call on May 3, they opened an investigation. On the same day, Lisa Zbozen , the spouse of Mr. Blades, announced on Instagram that their 18-month marriage had ended. The police issued the following statement: Jason Blades, 54, of Claverley, Wolverhampton, has been accused of using coercive and controlling behavior. He appeared at Kidderminster Magistrates Court this morning and has been bailed to appear at Worcester Crown Court on Friday 11th October, as quoted in a report by the BBC. Also Read : Cost for being a billionaire? Businessman who sold house at a discount of $6 mn sues agent after coming to know the buyer was Jeff Bezos Following the 2017 launch of The Repair Shop, where viewers could bring in their cherished items and heirlooms to be repaired, Mr. Blades rose to prominence as one of the most recognizable faces on British television. It started in a daytime slot and, as it gained popularity, was moved to primetime. In 2023, the program received a National Television Award and a Bafta for its royal special, in which the future King visited the workshop with a clock and a vase. The Repair Shop aired Mr. Blades' most recent episode on Wednesday. In 2022, he fronted a documentary about learning to read at the age of 51. He has also hosted Money for Nothing, Jay Blades' Home Fix, and Jay and Dom's Home Fix. In 2021, he received an MBE as a mark of honor. Filming on the upcoming season of The Repair Shop started in early May without him, as he announced he was taking a break to take stock after his uncle's alleged murder. In response to the news of Mr. Blades' court appearance, the BBC canceled a rerun of an episode of David & Jay's Touring Toolshed that aired on BBC One on Friday and featured Mr. Blades alongside actor David Jason. A repeat of Garden Rescue has taken its place instead. It would not be appropriate to comment on ongoing legal proceedings, as stated by a BBC spokesperson. Buckinghamshire New University announced that he had resigned as chancellor with immediate effect. However, Netflix will only consider the sequel, if the first season performs well and as per multiple media outlets, the response has been lukewarm. Returning Cast: Who Could Be Back for Pretties? While nothing is confirmed, we can expect several familiar faces to return for Pretties. Joey King, who starred as Tally Youngblood and served as an executive producer, is likely to reprise her role. Keith Powers , Brianne Tju , Jan Luis Castellanos , and Laverne Cox are also expected to return. One of the more significant questions involves Chase Stokes, who plays Peris. In the original Uglies book, Peris survives, but the movie adaptation hinted at a possible change to his fate. If the film stays true to the sequel novel, Peris will feature in key moments, meaning Stokes may return. Also Read : NHL 25: Release date, early access, cover athletes, platforms, trailer, features and gameplay New characters from the second book are also expected to join the cast, including Zane, the founder of the Crims, and other members of New Pretty Town’s elite social group. Plot: What Could Happen in Uglies 2? The first Uglies movie closely followed the events of the book, ending with Tally agreeing to undergo the transformation into a Pretty to help test a cure for the brain lesions that affect society’s elite. Pretties, the second book, picks up with Tally now fully integrated into the life of a Pretty. However, she begins to sense that something is wrong with her new reality. A message from her past soon disrupts her perfect life, forcing Tally to confront difficult choices: Should she fight to forget the truth and remain in her comfortable world, or should she reclaim the life she left behind? The sequel explores Tally’s internal struggle, her interactions with new characters like Zane and the Crims, and the consequences of the decisions she made in the first story. While Uglies made slight deviations from the book, particularly with Peris, Pretties is expected to remain faithful to the themes of the novel, potentially introducing new twists to keep viewers engaged. Trailer and Future Updates As Uglies 2 has yet to be officially confirmed, there is no trailer or teaser footage available for Pretties. Fans may have to wait until Netflix provides an update on the future of the series. The first trailer for Uglies was released only a month before the film’s debut, so a similar timeline could be expected if a sequel is announced. FAQs How many books are in the Uglies series? Uglies is a young adult book series by Scott Westerfeld, initially planned as a trilogy. After releasing the first three novels—Uglies, Pretties, and Specials—Westerfeld decided to add a fourth installment, Extras. What happens in the second Uglies book? Tally has finally achieved her dream of becoming Pretty. With flawless looks, a charming boyfriend, and a fantastic group of friends, her life seems perfect—just as she always wanted. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: The US elections 2024 has been a topsy-turvy ride for both the Presidential candidates , Donald Trump and Kamala Harris , and even thought the latter joined the poll race a little later, she is also feeling the complete heat of the contest. With just two months to go for the US Presidential Elections 2024 , things are still looking very dicey, with predictions of a win spread equivalently on both sides of the camps. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Donald Trump gets a breather It looks like Donald Trump can heave a sigh of relief, after a latest Economist/YouGov survey has predicted that he is closing in on Kamala Harris. The same survey had been consistently predicting earlier that Kamala Harris has the edge over the former US President, and after the DNC 2024, things were appearing to go Harris' way, based on the YouGov poll. Even in the September 1 to September 3 survey by YouGov, Harris was leading by at least 2 points against the former US President. The survey, conducted between September 8 to September 10 by the pollster, showed that both the candidates were tied in terms of choice, and this is actually the first time in more than a month, that Harris is not leading against Donald Trump in this survey. This could be a good sign as well as a glimmer of hope that Trump will still be able to push full throttle in the next two months, and manage a thumping victory against Kamala Harris. Will Donald Trump be able to pull off a win? Nothing can be said as of now, looking at the fact that the contest is vey close between Harris and Trump. The lopsided Presidential Debate has also contributed by some means in these elections, and some fresh polls will be able to clarify exactly how much the Kamala Harris vs Trump debate fared in the poll race. FAQs: Is Kamala Harris ahead in the US poll race? Kamala Harris is a definite favorite in the US poll race, but some polls suggest that Donald Trump is also closing in on his Democrat rival. content: Donald Trump and his latest tax plans that he has promised to the Americans if he and his Republican Party is voted to power, is already a major discussion point among people. Trump's promises till now had everything from education to economic policies, but the latest announcement around a revised tax plan is something the Democrats could not foresee till now. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Will new tax plan save Donald Trump? Most importantly, If Donald Trump manages to win the US elections 2024, it could be credit to his latest promises and assurances made to the Americans, with the latest addition being a reformed tax plans that would include a hefty cut in taxes. Also Read : What is happening in Southern California? 14 earthquakes so far this year, breaks record of quakes in single year; people living in fear A tax cut would result in a major relief for the Americans, across multiple income brackets, but it is yet to be seen if Kamala Harris, Trump's Democratic rival, manages to 'conjure' something out of thin air and counter this lucrative promise. Harris has been seen as phenomenal in the recently concluded US Presidential Debate, and is also a very sharp politician, and therefore, it can be assumed that she would have some trick up her sleeve to counter this tax plan narrative. Trump's tax plan speech welcomed by Americans Trump's big speech during a rally in Tucson, Arizona, on Thursday, included the fact that he would end all taxes on overtime, which would mean that the extra manual labor hours put in by Americans would be completely rewarded by the US economy and the government. This is something very new and innovative at this point and things could indeed go Trump's way if Americans actually consider this as a primary election promise. Trump has claimed that he has come to this decision of waiving taxes for overtime after consulting multiple economists, who are onboard with this though of his. content: Kevin Costner is under pressure to find a new high-profile girlfriend as he approaches his 70th birthday next year. People who know the 69-year-old actor well think Sandra Bullock would be a perfect fit. According to a source close to Kevin, he is not in a committed relationship at the moment because of his difficult year. The report mentioned that Costner faced further difficulties after his passion project, Horizon, did poorly at the Cannes Film Festival, as per the reports of Yahoo entertainment. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Sandra Bullock: A perfect match? According to the insider, Sandra Bullock fits what Kevin is looking for in a partner. They described Sandra as smart, self-made, and wealthy, qualities that are appealing to Kevin, especially given his recent financial issues. The actor reportedly wants to avoid gold-diggers and is wary of repeating the legal costs from his recent divorce. Sandra, who lost her longtime partner Bryan Randall in August 2023, is now single. Also Read : Reasonable Doubt Season 2: Showrunner reveals what’s next for Jax and Lewis | Challenges and considerations The source pointed out that both Sandra and Kevin are now single and open to new relationships for the first time in 30 years. However, Kevin’s ego might be a stumbling block. Sandra is described as humble and not overly concerned with her looks, whereas Kevin enjoys the spotlight and is seen as a sex symbol. The insider mentioned Kevin’s recent behavior at Cannes, where he was active in photo shoots and red carpet events. Kevin’s requirements for a new relationship Following his divorce from Christine Baumgartner, Kevin has certain rules for a new relationship. He is open to dating actresses but requires his partner to truly want a committed relationship, love children, have a career, and agree to a prenup. The insider emphasized that Kevin wants to avoid complications similar to his previous marriage, which ended in a contentious divorce in May 2023. The settlement involved significant child support payments and disputes over the marital home. Trump's statements have been cheered on by Republicans, who are looking for 'justice', which made him lose the elections. He says, do your own research Trump also called for military tribunals against Barack Obama In the earlier Truth Social posts by the former US President, he had called for military tribunals against former President Barack Obama and his associated for the 2021 attack on the Capitol. Trump has always been very vocal about using his executive powers and bringing his 'enemies to justice', something that has not been perceived very well by the international community, as it somehow looks like the exercising of executive power in the wrong way. Some legal experts have criticized these statements by Trump, claiming that this was quite similar to President Vladimir exercising undue powers to subdue his rivals. This runs on the borderline of 'extremism' and 'treason', suggest reports. According to a report published by Axios on Thursday, Loomer had been egging him on during the flight after Trump's other advisors advised caution and attempted to persuade him to stick to his messages about important voter concerns like the economy rather than pursuing long-standing grievances and easily refuted conspiracies like the idea that immigrants from Haiti are eating people's pets. A day later, Republican House Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene instigated a civil war by attacking a three-day-old Loomer post. Loomer posted an extremely racist message about Vice President Kamala Harris on X, and Greene chastised her for it. Loomer's tweet from September 8 referenced a post by Harris that highlighted her South Asian heritage. Loomer, a 9/11 conspiracist, accompanied Trump to the sombre memorial services on Wednesday in New York City and Pennsylvania three days later, the day following the debate. Greene decided it was finally time to speak out against discrimination. He had previously used racist and homophobic slurs and said that being called a white supremacist was equivalent to calling a black person the n-word. She referred to Loomer's post on X and declared on Wednesday that it is appalling and extremely racist, and it's not representative of MAGA or Republicans as a whole. This is not how President Trump is represented. This kind of conduct ought to never be accepted. Greene urged Loomer to take down the offensive post.
