Clarkson expressed gratitude that Top Gear had "grown out of something else" before evolving into the cultural phenomenon it became. “I started in 2002, doing originally just with Hammond, and then May came along in the second season of the series,” he explained, reflecting on the show's journey. This format helped solidify the trio's chemistry, which translated well to their later collaboration on The Grand Tour. The Final Farewell in The Grand Tour The Grand Tour was launched as a spiritual successor to Top Gear when the trio moved to Amazon Prime Video after Clarkson's controversial exit from the BBC. The show carried forward the same adventurous spirit and camaraderie but with larger, more expansive road trips. In the final episode, One For The Road, Clarkson, Hammond, and May embark on a road trip through Zimbabwe. The journey through beautiful yet challenging landscapes marks the end of a 22-year run of working together, leading to an emotional finale. As Clarkson explained, the episode is a nod to their earlier adventures. “The premise of the original Botswana film was: why, when you leave London and move to Surrey, do you always buy yourself a 4x4? You don’t need one. To prove this, we decided to drive three perfectly ordinary cars across Botswana." What’s Next for The Grand Tour? While The Grand Tour has come to an end with Clarkson, Hammond, and May at the helm, there is speculation about its future. Richard Hammond hinted that the series could continue with new presenters, although no concrete details have emerged. The trio’s departure marks the close of an era, but the concept of The Grand Tour may live on in a reimagined format. Also Read : Trump vs Harris on tariffs: Here’s how it is impacting the consumers For now, fans are left with a final adventure that blends humor, friendship, and the spirit of exploration—a fitting conclusion to a journey that began over two decades ago. FAQs How did Jeremy Clarkson lose Top Gear? In March 2015, the BBC announced Jeremy Clarkson's suspension following an alleged altercation in which he reportedly punched a producer over a dispute involving cold food and extended filming hours. As a result, the remaining episodes of the series were canceled. Who originally started Top Gear? The original show and its title were created by producer Derek Smith, who pitched the idea to BBC Midlands as a monthly television series. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: With soaring rumors of an impending recession and strong chances of US Federal Reserve slashing interest rates , Goldman Sachs has jumped on the opportunity of predicting a handful of stocks that could end up giving brilliant returns right after the Fed comes to the implementation stage. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Will some stocks see growth after Fed rate cuts? As per a Business Insider report, as soon as the Fed slashes interest rates, be it 25 or 50 bps, mid-cap stocks could see a far greater growth than others, helping in wealth generation for US investors, says Goldman Sachs. It is evident that ongoing recession fears could be detrimental for the US economy, but other market forces, including reduced inflation levels, are also being helpful to pacify US investors around the strength of the US economy. There is no official date around the Fed rate cut as of now, but as fears of an impeding recession grow stronger, some stocks are being forecasted to yield nearly 13% returns in the next year, following a rate slash. Mid-cap equities could be a major savior Mid-cap equities have, over the years, given significant returns to US investors, and with concerns around the volatility of the US economy, more people would begin relying on certain group of stocks in the mid-cap family for wealth generation in this scenario, feels Goldman Sachs. Moreover, mid-caps have the knack of offering optimum returns, in terms of growth and quality, and that too at a discounted price, which the large-caps do not offer. This makes it evident that US investors would turn to mid-cap stocks at this crisis period, and not rely on small-caps and large-cap stocks , that have poor profitability in vulnerable market conditions. New Content Apollo will include new stories, locations, missions and a variety of new weapons and gear. Like previous expansions, raids and dungeons will also be a significant part of the update. Each season that runs with Apollo will introduce new activities and mods. These features aim to enhance player experience by offering fresh challenges and rewards. content: A large tsunami that occurred in Greenland nine days ago due to glacier melting has been discovered by seismologists as an unprecedented event. Experts discovered unexplained vibrations in September of last year and located the source in a fjord in Greenland, where a landslide caused a wave that rose to a height of 650 feet. A unique phenomena that had never been seen before was created by the waves' constant bouncing against the walls of the fjord, as per the reports of Yahoo news. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} About 45 kilometers from the landslide on Ella Island, the tsunami also caused damage to a distant landmark. Waves at least thirteen feet high struck the island, which is frequented by Danish military personnel and scientists. Fortunately, no one was there when the accident happened, even though cruise ships had only been in the region a few days earlier. This seiche lasted longer than any previously documented seiche, as these episodes usually end in a few hours. Also Read : Nate Silver warns Kamala Harris of poll gains post U.S Presidential debate A growing problem linked to climate change While landslide tsunamis are not new, researchers believe they may be occurring more frequently. Landslides and the ensuing tsunamis are becoming increasingly frequent in the Arctic and subarctic due to the acceleration of permafrost erosion and glacier melting caused by climate change. A similar incident in Greenland in 2017 claimed four lives and destroyed multiple dwellings. Scientists are now concerned that as the world heats, more tsunamis may occur and affect vulnerable locations. Alaskan geologist Bretwood Higman is researching the possibility of tsunamis resulting from landslides. Warmer weather increases the likelihood of intense rainfall, which erodes slopes and causes landslides, as he and other experts have noted. The likelihood of becoming victims of these tragedies increases as more people travel to these arctic areas for vacation and resource exploitation. FAQs What caused the 650-foot tsunami in Greenland? content: Donald Trump appeared for his second US Presidential election this election cycle itself, this time against Kamala Harris, but could not deliver up to the expectations of the America, and even his own Republican base. Some comments that came in from the Republican camp itself, claimed that Trump had a bad night against Harris, and was not able to dominate his opponent. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Trump was more prepared in this debate, say Republicans However, his team claimed that Trump was more prepared in this debate, than he was during the first Presidential Debate against Joe Biden. According to the Independent's report, Trump fell for various baits laid out for him by Harris, and was even seen going on the offense when Harris talked about the small sizes of the crowd in some his rallies across the United States. Interestingly, this was a similar comment that Trump had consistently passed around Biden and Harris' initial campaign speeches across major US cities. He even claimed that the DNC 2024 was also poorly attended, and had posted along the same lines. Also Read : Single and ready to mingle: Is Sandra Bullock the girlfriend that Kevin Costner is looking for? Will Trump's dismal performance in debate become a missed opportunity? There are a lot of pollsters, who are stating that Donald Trump missed out on dominating Kamala Harris in the debate, which would mean a missed opportunity around gaining on some popularity ratings across major surveys and polls. Moreover, Trump's stance in the debate was seen as quite shaky and much on the offense, leading to major concerns about Trump losing his stronghold in the US elections . However, he still looks pretty good on paper, as the former US President has, throughout this election cycle, fared really well in the campaigns. Everything possible goes wrong in the movie. Cast The film stars David Dastmalchian, Keith Carradine, Katherine Waterston, Havana Rose Liu, and Lukita Maxwell, with John Cho leading the cast. If so, on December 28, 2024, the Afraid will become available. Nevertheless, some films have arrived sooner than expected. There have been other significant horror films released by Sony Pictures on Netflix before this one. Thanksgiving and Insidious: The Red Door were just added to Netflix's library of streaming titles. The Invitation was available for streaming until June 2024. It is also anticipated that the film will be released in late December or early 2025. Some Asian countries, such as India, receive first window releases besides the US. As of the time of publishing, the film had only made slightly over $10 million from ticket sales, indicating that it hasn't been a major box office hit yet. content: There were certain predictions regarding the decline of Twitter, which is now rebranded as X by Elon Musk. But the twist came from SimilerWeb, which is showing that Elon Musk 's social media platform is not just only surviving, but also performing well. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} X's Growth X, which was previously known as Twitter, is showing significant improvement from its rebranding in May 2024 and the user engagement is also very much impressive. During mid-July, the growth rate reached at a height of 28%. X maintained a growth of 22% by the end of August, which indicates that the social media platform is really influential and performing well. However, Mark Zuckerberg 's Facebook is facing some pressing issues based on controversial posts or stories, which are affecting its reputation. Facebook has seen a downturn in terms of user engagement, which is falling down from 9% to 10% each year. Also Read : Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are incredibly difficult to work with, say ex-employees Other Platforms Pinterest is a standalone performer in the world of social media. While Facebook is facing challenges based on user engagement, Pinterest has gained 13% increase in its user engagement by late August. Pinterest has gained more attention from users because of its visually-driven content and creativity. Some social media apps are attracting users based on their short-contents. It is very surprising that Linkedln , a social media platform for professional engagement, has experienced a downfall in its growth, from 13% to 4% drop within a few months. This highlights that even social networks, which are niche, are also facing challenges in this evolving digital landscape. content: Actor Chad McQueen , the son of Hollywood icon Steve McQueen, is being mourned by fans of the "Karate Kid" series. Famous for playing Dutch in the first "Karate Kid" movies, Chad died at the age of 63 in his Palm Desert, California, residence. The actor passed away on September 11; his longtime lawyer, Arthur Barens, confirmed the news. Organ failure, which resulted from an accident McQueen suffered a few years prior and subsequent complications, was the cause of death, as per the reports of the New York Post. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} In his last moments, Chad McQueen was with his kids, his life partner, and Barens. The news of his loss was announced on Instagram by his family, which included his wife Jeanie and two of his children, son Chase and daughter Madison. They conveyed their appreciation for his life and emphasized his roles as a devoted husband and a caring father. They also recalled his love of racing, which was a reflection of his father's principles and legacy. As they grieved and honored his life, the family wanted to be left in private. Also Read : Illia ‘Golem’ Yefimchyk, the world’s ‘most monstrous bodybuilder’, died at 36; here's why he became famous McQueen's son Steven R. McQueen, 36, is the only surviving child of his 1987 marriage to Stacey Toten. 1990 saw the couple's divorce. Career in film and racing Actor Chad McQueen has a distinguished career. Apart from playing Dutch in the films "The Karate Kid" and its follow-up "The Karate Kid II" , he also starred in other movies such as "Firepower" and "Surface to Air" . In addition, McQueen made a significant contribution to the preservation of his father's legacy by creating the documentaries "I Am Steve McQueen" and "Steve McQueen: The Man & Le Mans" , which recognized his father's contributions to the cinema and racing industries. content: The worst is yet to come, feels JP Morgan chief Jamie Dimon , if the US economy heads towards a stagflation . There is a lot of hope of an economic recovery towards the end of the year, after the US markets having facing a downslide over the past few weeks due to various market forces in play, and a fear of an impending recession among US investors. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Is the US economy actually heading for a stagflation? The chances of a stagflation cannot be taken off the table, feels Dimon, looking at the current US market scenario, which is behaving rather peculiarly, mostly due to the upcoming US Presidential elections, as well as the fears of an economic meltdown due to an incoming recession. Inflation has eased down a little over the past week, but the risks of it flaring up is high, looking at the fact that recession is also a nearing possibility in current circumstances. If the US economy indeed heads towards a stagflation, it could take months to steady the stock markets, which is already feeling the heat of the US elections, with Donald Trump and Kamala Harris already in a deadlock, in terms of winning possibilities. Inflation data showing recovery signs, other market factors in play While the inflation scenario is showing signs of dipping, there are other market forces that can drive the inflation back up, looking at the current fragile state of the US economy, which is not showing any sign of a proper recovery. If Dimon is to be believed, the US economy is not completely out of danger, and could still be at a major risk throughout the year. FAQs: Is inflation in the US reducing? US inflation data has shown signs of decrease, but could certainly flare up looking at the current state of the US economy, coupled with recession fears. content: Laura Loomer , a far-right agitator, stood out from the crowd during Donald Trump's visit to honor the anniversary of the September 11 attacks. Loomer, who is well-known for her divisive remarks, has gotten into Trump's inner circle. She recently went on a trip with him and was spotted with Trump's top advisers on a number of occasions. Her formal position within the campaign is still unknown, but her influence is clear because she often posts messages endorsing Trump's criticism of opponents in politics, as per the reports of CNN Politics. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} 9/11 conspiracy theories and anti-muslim views Loomer, Known for her controversial opinions, once posted a 9/11 conspiracy theory on social media, implying that the events were an "inside job." Loomer believes that despite her comments earning her the label of anti-Muslim, she accepts the part played by Islamic terrorists in the attacks but concentrates on the perceived threat posed by Islamic extremism. Her remarks sparked uproar and resulted in suspensions from a number of social networking sites, including Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. However, her accounts were reinstated following Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter. Also Read : Emily in Paris Season 5: Potential release date, cast and what to expect Trump’s relationship with conspiracy theorists Trump has long embraced conspiracy theorists and surrounded himself with individuals like Loomer, who amplify his message. For example, Loomer’s claims about Kamala Harris hiding her Black heritage have influenced Trump’s comments during public appearances. Some of Trump’s advisors, however, have distanced themselves from these statements, pushing back on the notion that Loomer directly shapes his views. Loomer’s controversial comments on immigration Loomer’s extreme views also extend to immigration. She recently promoted a false rumor that Haitian immigrants were responsible for eating pets in Ohio, which Trump repeated during a debate. This caused some concern among Trump’s allies, who questioned the validity of these claims. Despite the backlash, Trump’s advisors continue to highlight these rumors as a way to draw attention to crime among migrants in the U.S. Artificial Intelligence Java Programming with ChatGPT: Learn using Generative AI By - Part 2 of the season picks up with multiple twists as Emily and Gabriel 's newfound relationship falls apart as quickly as it began. Set against the stunning backdrop of Rome, the storyline takes unexpected turns, creating a mix of romantic drama and professional triumph for Emily, as mentioned in a Collider report. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Mindy Finds Redemption Amid Career Setbacks Mindy , facing challenges in her music career, becomes a central figure in the finale. After her boyfriend Nicolas pressures her to quit Eurovision due to a tabloid scandal, Mindy decides to end their relationship. Adding insult to injury, Nicolas releases their Eurovision song, leading to the band's disqualification. In an attempt to escape her troubles, Mindy joins Emily in Rome, where she rediscovers her passion for music. A spontaneous street performance in Rome goes viral, opening a new chapter for Mindy, who is invited to judge a singing competition in Shanghai. Sylvie’s Professional and Personal Tangles in Rome Sylvie also plays a key role in the finale. Her marriage faces complications when she suspects her husband, Laurent, of rekindling a relationship with his daughter’s mother. In retaliation, Sylvie engages in a brief romantic fling before flying to Rome to meet with Emily and Marcello , a client she aims to secure for Agence Grateau. While the blending of business and personal matters initially causes friction, Sylvie's passion for her work begins to take center stage. Her renewed focus on Agence Grateau leads her to successfully land Marcello’s family company as a client, although it strains her bond with Emily. After his relationship with Emily deteriorates, Gabriel learns that he is not going to be a father, and Camille expresses her desire to adopt. Struggling with feelings of loss, Gabriel is comforted by Genevieve, who later informs him that he is set to receive a Michelin star. Despite his professional success, Gabriel remains heartbroken over Emily. His emotional journey ends at a celebratory party where he contemplates his lingering feelings for her. Emily’s Love and Career Collide in Rome Emily's time in Rome brings both professional achievements and romantic setbacks. Her relationship with Marcello, initially a carefree escape from Paris, becomes complicated when Sylvie interferes. Marcello accuses Emily of using him for business purposes, leading to a temporary rift. Emily manages to salvage their relationship, only to jeopardize it again by pursuing a business opportunity with his family’s company. Despite the chaos in her love life, Emily’s professional success shines through. She secures a six-month trial deal for Agence Grateau and is later offered the opportunity to run the agency’s Rome office. Season 5 Set for Rome As Emily embraces her new role in Rome, Gabriel faces an internal conflict. Encouraged by Alfie to follow his heart, Gabriel decides to pursue Emily. The season ends with Emily enjoying her new life in Rome, while Gabriel, newly resolved, prepares to find her. The finale has a thrilling stage for Season 5 leaving fans excited for Emily's adventures, this time in the eternal city of Rome. FAQs: Is Camille pregnant with Gabriel's baby? Rather, the 28-year-old believes that his role is to encourage people to register to vote and assist them in conducting independent research before deciding what is best for them and their families. According to Patrick, the capacity for self-determination is what makes America so great. He has grown up with people from every aspect of life and every background, and he thinks the best thing about a football locker room and kind of how he has grown up in baseball lockers—everything about that is people can come together and achieve something and achieve a common goal. Whenever he hangs out with somebody, he is not thinking about their political views; rather, he is considering the people and their interactions with one another. It's about him and his family and how they treat other people, Patrick said. And Brittany does a lot in the community. He and his family will continue to live their lives to the fullest of their abilities and will not allow these political times to affect them for the time being. The trailer showcases Paddington's amusing attempts to get his passport photo taken in Paddington Station. His journey to visit Aunt Lucy in Peru turns into an unexpected adventure when she goes missing. Paddington and the Browns are then thrust into a quest through the Amazon rainforest and up the Peruvian mountains, ensuring plenty of laughs and excitement. Plot Synopsis The plot of Paddington in Peru centers around Paddington's visit to his Aunt Lucy, who now resides at the Home for Retired Bears. Directed by Dougal Wilson, the film takes Paddington back to his roots as he joins the Browns on an adventurous quest. According to StudioCanal, the plot sees Paddington’s peaceful visit turn into an extraordinary adventure as he searches for Aunt Lucy, leading them through the Amazon and the Andean peaks. Also Read : Cost for being a billionaire? Businessman who sold house at a discount of $6 mn sues agent after coming to know the buyer was Jeff Bezos Cast and Character Changes The cast of Paddington in Peru sees some changes from the previous films. Emily Mortimer steps into the role of Mrs. Brown, replacing Sally Hawkins. Hawkins has expressed her confidence in Mortimer, stating that she will bring her own charm to the role. Rachel Zegler, initially cast as Gina Cabot, is replaced by Carla Tous due to scheduling conflicts arising from the ongoing SAG-AFTRA strike. Returning to their beloved roles are Ben Whishaw as the voice of Paddington and Imelda Staunton as Aunt Lucy. Hugh Bonneville, Julie Walters, Madeleine Harris, Samuel Joslin, and Jim Broadbent will also reprise their roles. Joining the cast are notable actors Olivia Colman, who will portray the Reverend Mother, and Antonio Banderas as Hunter Cabot, a charismatic riverboat captain. Directorial Transition Paul King, the director of the first two Paddington films, has handed over the reins to Dougal Wilson for this installment. King expressed his confidence in Wilson’s ability to capture the essence of Paddington’s world, praising his imaginative and heartfelt approach. Wilson himself has expressed his excitement and honor in directing the film, highlighting the joy of working with both returning cast members and new additions. FAQs Was Paddington filmed in Peru? Filming locations include the Historic Center of Lima, Plaza Mayor, surrounding streets, and the Miraflores district. Was Paddington Bear from Peru? Although Paddington now resides in London, England, he originally hails from Peru. He was raised by his Aunt Lucy after being orphaned as a baby following an earthquake. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: In the 24 hours that followed her debate with former President Trump, Vice President Kamala Harris raised $47 million, her campaign revealed on Thursday. According to the New York Times, it's Harris' largest 24-hour fundraising total since she raised $81 million after unseating President Biden as the Democratic nominee for president in July. The haul, which included contributions from 600,000 people, is Harris's most recent boost. Several national polls show that Harris and Trump are virtually tied in the majority of swing states. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The amount of money raised for her campaign comes after her campaign raised $361 million in August, as opposed to Trump's $130 million. Jen O'Malley Dillon, chair of the Harris campaign, told the media that while their fundraising program continues to show historic strength, this momentum cannot be taken for granted. They must not undervalue Team Trump's power and their determined efforts to sow doubt and create division among Americans through effective fundraising and organizing. Until they finally defeat Trump this November, they won't give up. Also Read : Inside Out 2: When will it stream on Disney+? See streaming release date, plot, voice cast When asked about the amount of money raised by the Trump campaign, the director of campaign communications said that President Trump's campaign is powered by everyday Americans who are sick and tired of living in Kamala's America with soaring inflation, an out-of-control border that lets criminals and terrorists across, and rampant crime that threatens every community in the country. President Trump delivered a powerful debate performance where he dominated Kamala on the issues that matter to Americans, despite the moderators doing everything in their power to cover up for her. There has been no response from the Trump campaign on how much money it had raised following Tuesday's debate. This revelation brings even more tension into their already strained relationship, as mentioned in a report by TV Insider. The Evolution of Jax and Lewis’s Relationship Showrunner Raamla Mohamed shed light on Jax and Lewis’s journey in Season 2, revealing that both characters need to grow if their marriage is to survive. “We’re going to see two people who really love each other and want to make it work, and also see how both of them have to grow,” Mohamed shared as per a TV Insider’s report, emphasizing that while Season 1 focused on Jax’s growth, this season turns the spotlight on Lewis. “Lewis isn’t perfect either,” Mohamed teased, noting that the audience will witness his own struggles and development. The couple's journey will showcase their efforts to keep the fire in their relationship alive, despite the challenges they face. Also Read : Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are incredibly difficult to work with, say ex-employees According to Mohamed, Jax and Lewis share key elements that make their relationship work—friendship, fun, and passion. Therapy sessions for the couple will also play a crucial role in helping them navigate their issues. Corey Cash's Role in Jax's Life Beyond her marriage, Jax is facing complications in her professional world as well. Corey Cash, who takes charge of Shanelle’s defense case, presents a challenge for Jax, who is accustomed to being the one in control. Mohamed pointed out that while Jax appreciates Corey’s help, she struggles with relinquishing control to him. The tension between the two characters is palpable, but Mohamed highlighted the complexity of Corey’s character. Despite being portrayed as somewhat of a villain, Corey is likable. “He bonds with Daniel [Tim Jo] and Krystal [Angela Grovey], and he makes great points about what he wants to do,” Mohamed added. This multi-dimensionality of Corey’s character adds another layer to the ongoing drama. Jax's Loyalty to Shanelle While her relationship with Lewis may be faltering, Jax remains steadfast in her loyalty to her friend Shanelle. Even amid Shanelle’s legal troubles, Jax is determined to stand by her, showcasing the strength of female friendships. Mohamed emphasized the importance of portraying these friendships authentically. “I think that female friendships, especially close ones, and also portraying friendships where people aren’t just dismissive or judgmental is important,” Mohamed explained, noting that these dynamics create relatability for viewers. FAQs Who killed Kaleesha in Reasonable Doubt? Created by Raamla Mohamed, Reasonable Doubt centers on lawyer Jax Stewart, who takes on the high-profile case of Brayden Miller, a powerful businessman accused of murdering his employee, Kaleesha Moore. Who is Sarah in Reasonable Doubt? Brooke Lyons stars as Sarah Miller in Reasonable Doubt. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: This year has seen an unusually high number of earthquakes in Southern California, shattering the region's record for the most magnitude-4 and higher earthquakes in a single year. The U.S. Geological Survey reports that at 7:28 a.m. today, an earthquake with a magnitude of 4.7 struck Malibu. A 2.8 magnitude aftershock was felt shortly after the first earthquake, and four further aftershocks with magnitudes ranging from 2.7 to 3.5 were felt over the course of the next hour, as per the reports of Deadline. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The initial magnitude of the first earthquake was 5.1, however it was later revised to 4.7. The USGS confirmed that it was located five miles north of Malibu at a depth of seven miles. Thankfully, there haven't yet been any reports of significant property damage or catastrophic injuries. Record-breaking year for earthquakes in SoCal Further details were shared by USGS seismologist Lucy Jones in a broadcast Q&A after the earthquake. Jones reported that this year has experienced more magnitude-4 earthquakes in Southern California than typical. This year has already experienced fourteen earthquake sequences of magnitude 4 or greater, compared to the region's yearly average of roughly eight. Thirteen quakes in a single year was the previous record. Jones did stress that these numbers are still quite low and not statistically significant. Also Read : MAGA war: What's going on in Trump's inner circle? Two of his trusted aides trade blows in public Southern California has been hit by several significant earthquakes in recent weeks. On August 12, a 4.4 magnitude earthquake near Pasadena shook the area, just days after a 5.2 magnitude quake in Bakersfield was felt throughout Los Angeles County. Last week, smaller tremors, including a 3.9 magnitude quake, were recorded near Ontario, east of downtown Los Angeles. Using his iconic character’s voice, Leguizamo shared the news with enthusiasm: “We're about to do 'Ice Age' six—six.” This update has stirred anticipation among fans who have followed Sid’s adventures since the franchise began over two decades ago. Also Read : He prepared more for Harris than Biden: Donald Trump's allies admit his performance in U.S presidential debate was a missed opportunity Leguizamo also recounted his unique approach to developing Sid’s voice. He explained his research process by imitating sloths' natural behaviors, including storing food in cheek pouches. Although his experiment to ferment a sandwich didn't yield the desired results, it provided him with the inspiration needed to perfect Sid’s distinctive voice. "I called the director and said, 'Chris, guess who this is?' and he had no idea," Leguizamo reminisced, humorously imitating Sid. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program The Legacy of Ice Age Since its debut in 2002, the Ice Age franchise has become one of the highest-grossing animated film series of all time. With a global revenue exceeding $6 billion, the franchise has captivated audiences with its humorous and heartwarming tales of prehistoric creatures. The last theatrical release, Ice Age: Collision Course , continued the franchise's tradition of high-stakes adventures. The franchise, initially produced by Blue Sky Studios, was acquired by Disney following its purchase of 20th Century Fox. Under Disney’s stewardship, the series has expanded with spin-offs, including The Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild and the series Ice Age: Scrat’s Tales. While these new additions were produced by Bardel Entertainment and featured a different cast, they received mixed reactions, with Ice Age Adventures of Buck Wild earning a modest 32% audience score on Rotten Tomatoes. Also Read : Single and ready to mingle: Is Sandra Bullock the girlfriend that Kevin Costner is looking for? Future Prospects for Ice Age 6 Though plot details for Ice Age 6 have not been disclosed, Leguizamo’s announcement hints at the possibility of the original cast returning. Fans are hopeful that Ray Romano, who voices Manny the mammoth, Denis Leary as Diego the saber-toothed tiger, and Queen Latifah as Ellie could reprise their roles. The return of these core characters could invigorate the franchise and appeal to long-time fans. The Ice Age franchise has explored a range of imaginative storylines, from global cataclysms to extraterrestrial encounters. The new installment is expected to continue this trend, promising fresh and adventurous scenarios for the beloved characters. FAQs Will there be Ice Age 7 ? Ice Age 7 is not confirmed. How many Ice Age movies are there in total? The Ice Age franchise includes five main films: Ice Age , Ice Age: The Meltdown , Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs , Ice Age: Continental Drift , and Ice Age: Collision Course . content: In the race to win the Nov. 5 presidential election, Democratic U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris leads Republican Donald Trump 47% to 42%. This advantage has grown after a debate between the two candidates that voters largely believed she won, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that ended on Thursday. In the two-day survey, Harris's lead among registered voters was five percentage points, which was marginally higher than the four points she had over Trump in a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted from August 21–28. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} 53% of voters who said they had heard at least something about Tuesday's debate claimed Harris had won, 24% claimed Trump had, and the remaining voters either had not heard anything at all or had not responded. About 52% of those who watched the debate said that Trump faltered and didn't look intelligent, whereas 21% said the same about Harris. Five percent of Republican voters thought Trump lacked intelligence. In a fierce presidential debate, Harris repeatedly attacked Trump's suitability for office and his numerous legal issues, bringing up his felony conviction for allegedly falsifying business records. This put Trump on the defensive. Harris gave the impression of having higher moral integrity, according to 52% of voters who were familiar with the debate, compared to 29% who said the same of Trump. Also Read : U.S Elections: Who is Laura Loomer, far-right activist, who is influencing Donald Trump in his campaign A lot of Republicans were dissatisfied with how their candidate performed in the Philadelphia debate. In the poll, 53% of Republicans claimed that Trump had won the debate, while 91% of Democrats declared that she had. Republicans divided on the outcome: 31% thought no one won, while 14% thought Harris defeated Trump. In the survey, 91% of registered voters claimed to have heard at least some of the debate, and 44% claimed to have heard a lot. According to Nielsen data, 67.1 million television viewers watched the debate hosted by ABC News. This number exceeded the approximately 51 million viewers who watched Trump debate then-candidate President Joe Biden in June. Given that Trump is the older candidate in the contest, the poll found that 52% of voters believe he is too old to serve in government, compared to 7% who believe Harris is too old. This shows a little downfall from the previous poll. According to last month's version of the Marquette poll, Harris was ahead of Trump by a margin of 53% to 47% as specified in the report of Newsweek. The new survey is the key concern for Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee as she had faced a drop in her support which is 12% from the voters of 18 to 29 in Wisconsin, as compared with the previous poll. Harris was leading Trump on the basis of 51% to 36% and 31% were not yet decided, according to the latest poll. Harris has led by 63% to 33%, of which 4% is yet to decide, during the last month. Also Read : U.S Elections: Who is Laura Loomer, far-right activist, who is influencing Donald Trump in his campaign Increase in Support of Millennials Newsweek has sent an email to Harris campaign on Wednesday evening for a statement regarding this drop in. There is an increase in Trump's support which is 3 per cent, from the voters of the age group of 18 to 29 and the demographic is shifting largely from Harris to an undecided situation rather than supporting Trump. Former President is also upset with the result as he is losing an ample amount of support to millennials, who are in the age group of 30 to 44. Now, Harris is getting a good amount of support in the group of millennials, which is 42 to 52 per cent. Last month, Trump was ahead of Harris based on 52% to 38%. The show’s ability to blend romance, drama, and fashion has kept audiences engaged. Although Netflix has yet to officially announce the renewal of Emily in Paris for a fifth season, the series’ enduring popularity and the excitement surrounding the new setting in Rome suggest a promising outlook for its continuation, as per a report by Decider. Given the success of Season 4 and the unresolved storylines, it is plausible that the streaming giant might greenlight another season to explore the new narrative possibilities introduced in Rome. As per media reports, filming of Season 5 is expected to begin in 2025, hence fans can expect the release date either in mid 2026 or at the end of the same year. Season 4 Finale Recap Season 4, Episode 10, titled “All Roads Lead to Rome,” delivered a significant twist by moving the action to Italy. Emily, alongside her friends and colleagues, embarks on a journey that intertwines love and career. The finale sees Emily confronting challenges in her professional and personal life. Sylvie and the team arrive in Rome, and Mindy, having experienced a breakup and Eurovision disqualification, joins the Roman escapade. The episode follows Emily as she attempts to secure a business deal for her French marketing firm while navigating her complicated relationship with Marcello . Despite her efforts, Marcello rejects her proposal, but his mother’s intervention secures a meeting with Sylvie and the team, leading to a tense but successful pitch. Also Read : What is happening in Southern California? 14 earthquakes so far this year, breaks record of quakes in single year; people living in fear Meanwhile, Mindy’s impromptu performance in Rome goes viral, opening new opportunities in Shanghai, while Gabriel receives a Michelin star but faces personal turmoil as Emily is absent to celebrate. The episode concludes with Emily preparing to relocate to Rome to manage Marcello’s account, sparking a new chapter in her life. What Could Season 5 Look Like? If Netflix renews Emily in Paris for a fifth season, viewers can expect a continuation of the storylines developed in Season 4, as mentioned in a report by Decider. With Emily moving to Rome, the dynamics between her, Marcello, and Gabriel will likely take center stage. The show could delve deeper into Emily’s adjustment to her new role and her evolving relationships. The love triangle involving Emily, Gabriel, and Marcello is set to intensify, with Gabriel possibly trying to win Emily back. Additionally, the series may explore how the physical distance between Paris and Rome affects the core group of characters, including Alfie , Luc , Julien , and Sylvie . FAQs Is there going to be a season 5 of Emily in Paris? A fifth season has not yet been officially confirmed. Does Alfie break up with Emily? content: Leo Kryss , a businessman, found out that Jeff Bezos was the buyer of his property and is suing Douglas Elliman for $6 million. At $68 million, Kryss sold the property for a substantial amount less than its asking price of $85 million. He alleges that the agency deceived him by not revealing Bezos's identity throughout the transaction, as per the reports of Yahoo Finance. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Kryss, who co-founded the toy and electronics company Tectoy, listed his seven-bedroom mansion in Miami’s exclusive Indian Creek island for $85 million. The house features a wine cellar, library, and theater. The sale price was lowered to $79 million following an offer shortly after Bezos purchased a neighboring property for $68 million. Misrepresentation claims According to reports, Kryss suspected that Bezos might be behind the bid. However, a Douglas Elliman employee assured him over the phone that Bezos was not involved and that the buyer would not pay more than $79 million. Relying on this assurance, Kryss agreed to the discount. He later learned that the buyer was actually linked to Bezos. Also Read : Reasonable Doubt Season 2: Showrunner reveals what’s next for Jax and Lewis | Kryss has filed a complaint in a Miami court, stating that knowing Bezos was involved would have greatly impacted his negotiations and decision on the sale price. Dana Clayton, Kryss’s lawyer, argues that Douglas Elliman did not meet its duties by not revealing the identity of the ultimate buyer. The Instagram account @whoisthebestbb confirmed on Wednesday that Illia 'Golem' Yefimchyk passed away last week. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} According to Belarusian and Russian media, the athlete reportedly had a heart attack at home on September 6 and went into a coma, as reported by the Daily Mail. Anna, his wife, allegedly gave him chest compressions while they awaited the ambulance. The bereaved widow told the local media that she spent every day by his side, hoping, and his heart started beating again for two days, but the doctor gave her the terrible news that his brain had died. She appreciates the condolences from everyone. Realizing that she is not alone in this world and that so many people have offered to support and help her makes her feel incredibly warm and fuzzy. Because of his incredible 6-foot, 340-pound frame, Yefimchyk was known as The Mutant in the bodybuilding community, according to Muscle and Fitness. Yefimchyk asserted that he could bench press 600 pounds, deadlift 700 pounds, and squat 700 pounds. Yefimchyk's passing was announced not long after 34-year-old British bodybuilder Neil Currey and 26-year-old Brazilian competitor Antonio Souza passed away. In September 2023, Currey was discovered deceased within his apartment. According to the BBC, his parents blamed his death on long-term steroid use. On August 3, shortly after placing in the top 3 of a competition, Souza passed away from cardiac arrest, according to UNILAD. content: Hyderabad: The Telangana Government on Tuesday requested the 16th Finance Commission to increase the share of states in Central taxes from the existing 41 per cent to 50 per cent as over the years cesses and surcharges that are not shared with states have increased. Deputy Chief Minister in-charge of Finance Bhatti Vikramarka in his speech at the meeting with Finance Commission Chairman Arvind Panagariya and members also urged the finance panel to ensure that states are given the necessary autonomy to tailor CSS programmes to their specific development needs. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} "In addition, we propose increasing the share of states in Central taxes from 41 per cent to 50 per cent. Over the years, cesses and surcharges that are not shared with states have increased, leaving states with a smaller share of total gross tax revenue ," he said. Increasing the vertical devolution will give states the fiscal space they need to strengthen welfare programmes, address infrastructure gaps and prioritise local development, he further said. He, however, said it is not just a demand for Telangana but for all states, ensuring a more cooperative federal structure that will benefit the nation as a whole. Bhatti further said the state government urges the Finance Commission to reconsider the use of per capita income distance as the primary indicator in determining horizontal devolution as measuring prosperity and well-being solely by per capita income would deny Telangana the resources needed to address the inequities that exist within the state. "A greater weight on GSDP would incentivise states to adopt reforms that improve productivity, attract investment and create jobs, ultimately contributing to the national economy. This approach would not only make states more competitive but also help reduce regional disparities, encouraging more balanced growth across the country," he opined. Pointing out that certain expenditures for schemes such as Rythu Bharosa , farm loan waivers and food subsidies are often mislabelled as "freebies," he urged the Commission to recognise these programmes as necessary investments in the welfare of our people. He mentioned that a large part of the state's resources is now being diverted toward debt servicing and hence requested the Finance Commission's support in either restructuring this debt or providing additional assistance to help free up resources for further development. content: A rebound in government expenditure is evident from a build-up of surplus liquidity conditions in the banking sector, as the Centre loosens its purse strings and injects cash into the system. The absence of the key driver of economic growth had been felt in the first quarter of the year. Analysts are of the view that the Reserve Bank of India’s tolerance of surplus liquidity suggests it could be gradually gearing up toward a softer monetary policy . #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Last week, while emphasising that India’s growth story remains intact after a lower-than-expected expansion of 6.7% in the GDP in June quarter, central bank governor Shaktikanta Das buttressed his statement by saying that government expenditure would pick up pace for the rest of the year in line with budget estimates. Banking system metrics suggest that the pick-up has been steadily underway for the last couple of months. For all of July, August and so far in September, the banking system has experienced surplus liquidity conditions, with the average amount of funds lenders have parked with the Reserve Bank of India on a daily basis clocking in at Rs 1.34 lakh crore, an analysis of central bank data showed. When the RBI absorbs funds from banks it indicates the prevalence of surplus liquidity conditions. From a peak of more than Rs 5 lakh crore in May, when elections were in full swing, the government’s cash balance has dropped sharply now, indicating the Centre’s spending push. “The rise in liquidity conditions represents a pick-up in government expenditure post the election,” said Gaura Sengupta, chief economist, IDFC First Bank . “This is reflected in the reduction of the government cash surplus to Rs 2.3 lakh crore as of August 2024 from peak levels of Rs 5.1 lakh crore as of May 24.” Banking system liquidity was broadly in deficit mode in May and June. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Digital Marketing By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program Spending by the government typically flows through the banking system, thereby increasing cash with lenders, although expenditure reforms by the Centre over the past few years have reduced that float. Das had said last week that the headline GDP growth number for the first quarter had printed lower than expectation, perhaps due to muted spending by the Centre and states during the general elections, which ended in early June. Borrowing Costs, RBI Stance The easier cash conditions in the banking system over the past two months have brought down the weighted average rate for the overnight segment of money markets, which represents banks’ overnight cost of funds. “One of the most notable statements in the recent speech by the RBI governor was that the balance for growth and inflation is very well poised. This is a significant shift from the August policy statement where he mentioned unambiguous focus on inflation,” said Anubhuti Sahay, head, India, economic research, Standard Chartered Bank. “Assuming there are no negative surprises on inflation, I think the comfort with liquidity is likely to remain and that can then move a step forward by bringing a change in stance and then probably rate cuts beginning by the end of the year.” The weighted average rate for the overnight segment of money markets has averaged 6.38% from July 1 to September 5, 12 basis points lower than the central bank’s repo rate of 6.50%. A basis point is 0.01 percentage point. The easier liquidity and lower cost of overnight funds has reduced yields on the government’s treasury bills, which are used as pricing benchmarks for various credit products across the economy. From an auction on June 26 to the latest on September 4, yields on T-bills of different maturities have dropped 17 basis points to 24 basis points, RBI data showed. In 2023, when the RBI was faced with an abrupt rise in food inflation in the second half of the year, the central bank was averse to tolerating surplus liquidity in the banking system, given its potential inflationary impact. In the last few months, the RBI has taken some steps to rein in the amount of rupee liquidity being added to the banking system through foreign flows into debt. The central bank has conducted open market bond sales worth a total Rs 18,225 crore through secondary market operations between mid-July and now. However, it has stopped short of conducting large-scale, open-market sales of government bonds through auctions. Indian debt markets received net inflows worth $4.8 billion in July and August, official depository data showed. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: The expansion of the Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana health coverage to all citizens over 70 years of age will involve central outgo of nearly ₹2,000 crore per annum, said people with knowledge of the matter. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} In keeping with the ongoing PMJAY scheme, the funding will be in the ratio of 60:40 for the Centre and states, respectively. The ratio is 90:10 for the north-eastern states and three Himalayan states and Union Territories. The government's allocation for the flagship universal health coverage scheme was increased in the budget for 2024-25 to ₹7,300 crore from the revised estimate of ₹6,800 crore for the financial year. It is not yet clear if this would suffice to absorb the additional cost for increased central share on account of the latest extension of the scheme to senior citizens . For now, however, the government has yet to accept the other expansion proposal to double the health coverage to ₹10 lakh which could increase the overall cost to the exchequer considerably. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program On Wednesday, the Union cabinet approved the health coverage to all senior citizens in the country aged 70 years and above irrespective of income under the flagship scheme. It is expected to benefit about 45 million families - with 60 million senior citizens - with free health insurance cover of ₹5 lakh per family per annum. An electoral promise that figured prominently in the BJP's manifesto ahead of the Lok Sabha polls, the expanded AB-PMJAY could, however, spark political controversy over central funding . At present, about a dozen states are already giving a range of health coverage benefits to senior citizens over 70 years of age, at their own cost. The latest expansion of AB-PMJAY will allow them the opportunity to get 60:40 fund sharing, with the Centre footing a larger share of the bill. This process, however, will involve merging the component with the centrally sponsored scheme and adopting its rulebooks and nomenclature, which underlines the central role. The Centre is unlikely to allow separation of the expanded scope of the scheme - health coverage for those above 70 years of age - as an independent scheme, according to the people cited earlier. Several such schemes have run into rough weather, especially in the opposition-ruled states, on account of political messaging. A case in point is Tamil Nadu's continued wrangling with the Union education ministry over the PM SHRI model school scheme tied up with Samagra Shiksha funding. Similar instances have been seen in West Bengal and Punjab, among other states. The original AB PM-JAY scheme also took time to scale up for similar reasons. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Seven prominent Indian institutions, including the prestigious IIT Delhi and Anna University in Chennai, are facing a significant financial challenge: they have received showcause notices from the Directorate General of GST Intelligence for unpaid taxes on research grants given since 2017. This move has sparked a major debate within the academic community, with some calling it "tax terrorism", ToI reported. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The DGGI's stance is that research and development grants received by educational institutions are not exempt from taxes, but many academicians, scientists, and funding agencies argue otherwise, noting that such grants are typically hard to secure and are often tax-exempt in other countries. Institutions like IIT Delhi have been asked to pay ₹120 crore, including penalties, over the past seven years. Others are facing demands ranging from ₹5 crore to ₹60 crore. Infosys co-founder T V Mohandas Pai voiced his discontent on social media, tagging GST India and PM Modi, calling the situation “tax terrorism.” Also Read: IIT-Delhi, Anna University & several other institutes get GST notice “GST on research grants will reduce money allocated for research. So, the govt must remove GST,” said Kris Gopalakrishnan, another Infosys co-founder who is a strong advocate for education and funds research projects in institutions like IIT and Indian Institute of Science . ToI said, according to experts, research inherently involves risks, and without the burden of taxes, institutions are more likely to invest in innovative, high-risk projects potentially leading to groundbreaking discoveries. They argue that some significant research studies span several years. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Digital Marketing By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program Orthopaedic surgeon Dr George Thomas, former editor of the Journal of Indian Medical Ethics, emphasized the importance of long-term investments in research. “The Framingham Heart Study, for instance, is a long-term, ongoing cardiovascular cohort study of residents of Massachusetts that began in 1948,” he said. “The National Institutes of Health invested USD 14 million in the Lower Extremities Assessment Project , a comprehensive research initiative designed to evaluate and improve outcomes in patients with severe injuries of the legs. Without large investments, breakthrough research is difficult. Taxing research grants reduces the already low investments.” Researchers also pointed out that funds for research have not increased in line with inflation, while the scope of research has expanded. Scientist Ashok Jhunjhunwala, who has chaired government committees and boards of institutions like IIT, suggests that GST on research grants could be absorbed by the grantee. “When researchers receive grant money from the ministry, the govt should pay the GST. Researchers would welcome it because they currently pay GST on equipment or components bought with grant funds. If grants were given with GST already paid, they could offset the GST costs they currently bear,” he explained. Research grants are typically itemized with specific amounts allocated for equipment, components, travel, salaries, and overheads. “Where is the GST money supposed to come from within this? Placing a GST demand on research institutions is just harassment,” Jhunjhunwala further elaborated. Several universities are now preparing for litigation against the GST demand, but legal experts are urging the Centre to reconsider before the matter reaches the courts. “GST is levied on the supply of goods and services,” stated K Vaitheeswaran, an advocate and tax expert heading the taxation committee of the Madras Chamber of Commerce and Industry. “For example, at a shop there is a tax on sold goods. GST is on the supply of goods or services for consideration. When a university receives a research grant, there is no quid pro quo to provide any goods or services. A grant is not a consideration; it is akin to a donation.” Legal experts argue that research outcomes are uncertain and may not always result in saleable goods or services. Therefore, research grants and donations, whether from government or private agencies, should not be taxed based on anticipated outcomes but on actual monetized results. They further noted, “When income tax provides an accelerated tax shield for research institutions notified under section 35, GST too should extend the same reasoning and logic for research grants.” Delhi Minister Atishi expressed her opposition to GST on research grants and other services during a GST Council meeting. “Show cause notices have been sent to big educational institutes including IIT Delhi and Punjab University. It is wrong. Research is an investment in development of the country. There shouldn't be a GST on research grants. On one hand, the Centre is decreasing the research grants and on the other, they are levying GST. We will oppose it,” she said. She also noted concerns about GST potentially being levied on online payments via gateways, which could burden startups. Academicians are hopeful that this issue will be discussed at the GST Council meeting on September 9, chaired by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman . “Research grants to universities must be considered a subsidy as funds are used solely for delivering public good without any profit motive, making it a quasi-government endeavour by the university,” said one academician. T V Mohandas Pai suggested setting up an expert committee within GST India akin to the one at the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India. “Questions should be referred to this committee, position paper prepared, put out for public comments and after that issued as the official view,” he recommended. “This will ensure uniform policy throughout the industry and eliminate arbitrary action by GST officers which harm the country and business as well as reduce tax terrorism. Officials must raise contestable questions and debate it out before they issue such notices. Tax on research grants given to universities can have a chilling effect on research outputs. I hope it’s axed.” #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}
title: Tax terrorism? A storm brewing in India’s academic circles can't be taken for granted - The Economic Times
author: ET Online

content: The GST Council ’s meeting on Monday added some flavor to the Indian tax system, announcing significant cuts aimed at making essential services and goods more affordable. Among the key reductions were tax cuts on cancer drugs, helicopter travel, and snacks like namkeen . #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} In a series of decisions, the Council reduced GST on select cancer medications to 5 per cent, cut the levy on fried snacks from 18 per cent to 12 per cent, and lowered the tax on shared helicopter rides to 5 per cent. Drugs : Among the most significant decisions, the reduction of GST on life-saving cancer drugs like Trastuzumab Deruxtecan , Osimertinib, and Durvalumab from 12 per cent to 5 per cent was praised as a step towards making these treatments more accessible. Industry experts highlighted the importance of this move, which complements the customs duty exemption for cancer drugs announced earlier this year. "With the increasing burden of chronic diseases in India, this is a move toward making life-saving drugs accessible and improving health outcomes," said Sudarshan Jain , secretary general of the Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance. R&D activities : The Council also agreed to exempt research and development activities funded by private and public sources, including universities, from GST, marking a win for educational institutions engaged in R&D under central or state laws. Helicopter travel booking : The decision to reduce GST on helicopter travel booked on a 'seat-share' basis to 5 per cent will benefit travelers to popular pilgrimage destinations like Kedarnath-Badrinath and Vaishno Devi. However, chartered helicopter services will continue to attract the higher 18 per cent GST. Namkeens : The GST rate has been reduced prospectively from 18 per cent to 12 per cent for namkeens and savoury items. In addition to these tax reductions, the Council deferred decisions on two key issues: lowering GST on health and life insurance and extending the compensation cess beyond January 2026. These matters were referred to two ministerial panels for further consideration. The panel on insurance, led by Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary , will review the exemption thresholds, treatment of senior citizens, and group insurance sales by resident welfare associations, with recommendations expected by the end of October. The Council also clarified that uncooked or unfried snack pellets will attract a 5 per cent tax, while increasing the GST on car and motorcycle seats from 18 per cent to 28 per cent. Roof-mounted package unit air conditioners used in railways were also moved into the highest GST slab. The decision on taxing electric vehicle charging stations was postponed. content: Himachal Pradesh ministers recently decided not to withdraw salaries for the next two months as Congress-led state government is struggling to fulfil its poll promises amid a significant debt burden. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Himachal's total debt of ₹95,000 crore is highest among the hill states, but it is not the only state with a worrying spike in state debt in recent times. Poll promises and freebies are exerting pressure on finances of at least five other states ruled by different parties, leaving little room for other development works. They include Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana and Punjab. Madhya Pradesh Ladli Behna scheme proved to be a gamechanger for BJP in the last year's elections, but the state government is facing severe financial burden due to this and a few other poll promises.
