Agarwal said the candidates who have filed nominations for the elections can withdraw their nominations until September 16. After this date, the final list of candidates for the 90 assembly constituencies of the state will be published, he said. In the Haryana Assembly elections of 2014, 1351 candidates had contested, whereas in the 2019 Assembly elections, this number was 1169. While the ruling BJP is eyeing to return to power for a third term, among the opposition parties in the fray include Congress, AAP, JJP-ASP and INLD-BSP. Polling for the 90 assembly seats in Haryana will be held on October 5 and votes counted on October 8. The ruling BJP is eyeing a hat-trick in the assembly polls but faces a stiff challenge from a resurgent Congress, which is looking to cash in on the anti-incumbency factor. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: The agitating junior doctors in West Bengal on Friday wrote to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi , seeking their intervention to ensure speedy justice to the trainee doctor of the RG Kar Medical College & Hospital who was found raped and murdered last month. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The West Bengal Junior Doctor's Front also raised their safety and security concerns and highlighted the "dire and deplorable circumstances" in the "medical fraternity of the state" in the four-page letter, which was also sent to Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar and union health minister JP Nadda. Raising the issue of the rape-murder of the trainee doctor, the letter said the "gruesome nature of the crime", the alleged attempts to cover it up and the attendant atmosphere of fear "woke the nation up to demand an impartial investigative process and a speedy, fair and rational trial". "Your intervention in these trying times will act as a beacon of light to us all, showing us the way ahead out of the darkness that surrounds us," the letter said. The doctors wrote about a "dearth of adequate infrastructure" and "facilities to ensure the safety of the health care workers" in the state's medical colleges and hospitals. The sit-in protest in front of the West Bengal Health Department headquarters in Kolkata entered its fourth day Friday, with no sight of a resolution as the doctors continued to demand livestreaming of any meeting with the government that the administration did not agree to. content: Notwithstanding the relaxation in bail conditions by the Supreme Court while releasing him in the CBI's corruption case in excise policy 'scam', Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal still cannot visit his office at the secretariat and sign any official file. A bench of Justices Surya Kant an Ujjal Bhuyan retained only two bail conditions that he shall remain present before the trial court on each and every date of hearing, unless exempted and fully cooperate in expeditious conclusion of the trial. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} It decided to do away with the conditions that the chief minister cannot go to Delhi Secretariat or sign files. However, the relief in the present case cannot be enforced as a bench headed by Justice Sanjiv Khanna, on May 10, 2024 and July 12, 2024, had imposed these conditions and made clear that they can only be recalled or modified be a larger constitution bench. Kejriwal will have to seek modification of these restrictions by approaching the chief justice of India to set up a larger bench. The top court also imposes a slew of other conditions and directed that Kejriwal be released on bail upon furnishing bail bonds for a sum of Rs 10 lakh with two sureties of such like amount, to the satisfaction of the trial court. This condition is necessitated to dissuade a recent tendency of building a self-serving narrative on public platforms. "However, this shall not preclude the appellant from raising all his contentions before the trial court. The terms and conditions imposed by a coordinate bench of this court vide orders dated May 10, 2024 and July 12, 2024 are mutatis mutandis in the present case," the bench said. In a major relief to Kejriwal, the top court granted him bail in the corruption case lodged by the CBI in connection with the excise policy 'scam'. content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hailed the renaming of Port Blair as Sri Vijaya Puram and said it reflects the government's commitment to break free from the colonial mindset and celebrate our heritage . Earlier, Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that Port Blair, the capital city of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands , has been renamed Sri Vijaya Puram. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} In a post on X, Modi said, "The name Sri Vijaya Puram honours the rich history and heroic people of Andaman and Nicobar islands. It also reflects our commitment to break free from the colonial mindset and celebrate our heritage," the prime minister said. Shah earlier said the decision was taken to free the nation from colonial imprints as the Andaman and Nicobar Islands had an "unparalleled place" in the country's freedom struggle and history. "Inspired by the vision of Prime Minister @narendramodi ji, to free the nation from the colonial imprints, today we have decided to rename Port Blair as 'Sri Vijaya Puram'," Shah said on X. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: New Delhi: Ahead of the assembly elections in Haryana, the protesting farmers unions have upped the ante against the ruling BJP and will hold two major rallies in the state to push for a minimum support price guarantee legislation. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} The Samyukt Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Sangharsh Morcha have given a call for a mahapanchayat in Jind on Sunday. This will be followed by another rally the following Sunday in Pipli, the place in Kurukshetra where the farmers had initiated their protest last year demanding procurement of sunflower seed at MSP. Speaking to ET, Kisan Mazdoor Sangharsh Committee leader Sarvan Singh Pandher said, "Farmers from across Haryana and certain districts of Punjab will gather at the two places to put forth their demands - first in Jind and then in Pipli. We will chart our future course of action at the mahapanchayat in Jind." The farmers have been protesting against the incumbent BJP government in Haryana from February this year since they were stopped at the Punjab-Haryana border and not allowed to march till Delhi. According to sources, the unions are internally discussing how to oppose the ruling party in the forthcoming elections. When asked if a call to boycott the BJP will be given, Pandher said, "All options are being weighed." The call given at Khanauri and Shambhu - the two places on Punjab-Haryana border where the farmers were camping - was "Any party but the BJP". The farmers did not even allow BJP candidates to enter the villages to campaign in Punjab. Pandher further said, "We will discuss how to put forward our demands and then take a common call. Even in Punjab, the morcha did not give a call to boycott BJP or openly say that BJP candidates should not be allowed in villages. The farmers on the ground decided on their own." The anger amongst farmers was so palpable in Punjab that the BJP did not win a single parliamentary seat in the state. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: The Supreme Court Friday ordered forthwith release of Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, who was arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation in the Delhi excise policy case on June 26, soon after he got bail in a money-laundering case filed by the Enforcement Directorate . #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} While concurring that Kejriwal should be released on bail, a division bench comprising Justices Surya Kant and Ujjal Bhuyan authored two separate judgements with the latter slamming the CBI for Kejriwal's "belated" arrest as "unjustified". Justice Bhuyan said Kejriwal's continued incarceration in the CBI case "has become untenable". In his judgement, Justice Kant ruled that "Kejriwal's arrest does not suffer with any procedural infirmity". Recording that the "trial is unlikely to occur in the immediate future", Justice Kant said that in CBI's case, 17 accused and 224 individuals have been identified as witnesses besides "extensive documentation, physical and digital". Holding that although the procedure for Kejriwal's "arrest meets the requisite criteria for legality and compliance", the judge said "continued incarceration for an extended period pending trial would infringe" his right to liberty. Dr. C.P. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program The bench noted that given Kejriwal's position and his roots in the society, "there seems to be no valid reason to entertain the apprehension of his fleeing the country". The top court directed Kejriwal to not make any public comments on the merits of the CBI case. "This condition is necessitated to dissuade a recent tendency of building a self-serving narrative on public platforms," Justice Kant held in his judgement. In his separate judgement, Justice Bhuyan expressed "serious reservations" on conditions imposed by another division bench in the ED case debarring Kejriwal from attending the office of the chief minister and Delhi secretariat as well as from signing files. However, "having regard to judicial discipline, I would refrain from further expressing my views thereon at this stage since those conditions have been imposed in the separate ED case by a two-judge bench of this court", he added. "It is imperative that the CBI dispel the notion of it being a caged parrot," Justice Bhuyan said. "In a functional democracy governed by the rule of law, perception matters. Like Caesar's wife, an investigating agency must be above board," he said in the judgement. CBI's perception should rather be "that of an uncaged parrot", Justice Bhuyan added. The CBI is the premier investigating agency of the country and it is in public interest that it must not only be above board but must also seem to be so, he said. CBI's arrest of Kejriwal "raises more questions than it seeks to answer", Justice Bhuyan said. Questioning the "necessity and timing" of the arrest, he said "it is evident that the CBI did not feel the need and necessity to arrest" Kejriwal for over 22 months and it was only after he got regular bail in the ED case that the agency "activated its machinery and took the appellant into custody". The judge said the CBI "cannot justify arrest and continued detention citing evasive reply". #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Enforcement Directorate on Friday conducted search operations at multiple locations across West Bengal in connection with the alleged ration scam. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} ED sleuths searched the homes and godowns of ration shop traders, a food inspector's residence, and a cooperative bank branch in North 24 Parganas district's Joynagar, Deganga, Hooghly district's Kalyani, and South 24 Parganas' Basanti. A team of agency officials also conducted raids in Kolkata, people in the know said. Former food minister Jyotipriya Mallick was arrested in October last in connection with the ration scam. In July, the ED had raided 10 locations across the state related to the same case. These included the residences of Sheikh Shahjahan, Bakibur Rahman, Anisur Rahman, and Barik Biswas, all of whom are close aides of Mallick. Bakibur Rahman is out on bail. Notably, the ED officials were attacked on January 5 in Sandeshkhali allegedly by Trinamool supporters and followers of leader Sheikh Shahjahan, with three officers receiving serious injuries, as they tried to raid the residence of Trinamool Congress leader Shahjahan Sheikh in connection with the ration distribution case. content: Rows of heirloom sarees draped on bamboo frames at the Delhi Crafts Council exhibition last week in New Delhi gleaming mesmerizingly. By Indian historical standards, they were not old, much less ancient, given that the earliest extant woven Indian textile dates from the Saraswati-Sindhu civilisation, 7,200-year-old microfibres of which were found in an Israeli village in 2022. Sarees well over a century old are still worn proudly by their current owners, after all. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} But the fact that those ancient Indian fibres found thousands of miles away in Israel had been dyed in natural tints of blue, purple, pink, green and black added a different dimension to the exhibited sarees. At least for those who regard sarees as not merely six yards of embellished cloth but as exemplars of India's living tradition. After all, many of the vintage sarees on display were also dyed in the same shades, probably even using the same natural colouring agents. There is a timeless sheen to older sarees, not merely because of the quality of raw materials used back then, from fine cotton and silk yarns to pure gold and silver zari threads, but also the motifs used on the body, borders and pallus. The sarees were delicately crafted, with no corners cut in terms of design and execution. They were also made to last forever, not as a measure of thrift but as tangible proof of their skill as master spinners, weavers, dyers and embroiderers. Many of today's sarees are garish by comparison, with coarser threads, mostly gaudy chemical dyes and designs that seek to bedazzle rather than charm. Price tags are no guarantee of excellence either. Look at the kantha and chikankari of today and yesteryear, the ikats of yore and now, Kanchipurams , Jamdanis , Benarasis Patans , Paithanis... Human beings are far more knowledgeable now than they were several millennia ago. There is far wider access to both education and information as well. Yet our tastes do not seem to become more refined, even though the very same brains continue to take technology to dizzying heights. Why is there an overweening preference for big, blingy and brash, be it in car design, jewellery, houses or, indeed, saree motifs among otherwise 'evolved' humans? Dr. C.P. Gupta, Professor: Department of Finance and Business Economics, University of Delhi View Program Marketing Performance Marketing for eCommerce Brands By - Zafer Mukeri, Founder- Inara Marketers View Program Worse still, we are now living in the age of fast fashion, which is not meant to be preserved for even the next season, much less the next century or millennium. Instead, tons of those unmemorable garments are destined for landfills, or being virtuously recycled for equally ephemeral purposes. Sadly, when our civilisation is excavated in some distant future, these are what will be discussed threadbare in order to understand the contradictory 'material culture' of our times. What will these mass-made, synthetically coloured textiles reveal about us 21st century Indians? A people devoid of discernment? A civilisation obsessed with quantity over quality, novelty over authenticity? A culture that wilfully turned its back on time-tested older practices in the name of expediency, even after evidence emerged that not all scientific 'progress' counted as improvement and some-like chemical dyes-could be harmful for us in the long run? Excavators in the distant future may be puzzled, though, if they discover a few sarees from that Delhi Crafts Council exhibition amid the detritus of fast fashion in a mound that was once the grand city of New Delhi. Those exquisite sarees, woven just a few decades before those ersatz garments and yet somehow linked to millennia older micro-fibres found in Israel, may be our saving grace, belying uncomplimentary theories about the trajectory of our 'civilisation'! #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's third term in office will set the framework for the century, where India will emerge as the world's largest economy, with the US as a key partner in the growth story, John Chambers , chairman of US India Partnership Forum said. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Known as a visionary in the tech world, Chambers suggested the creation of a sovereign wealth fund for investments in emerging technologies, starting with artificial intelligence , cybersecurity and semiconductors. Chambers, also chairman emeritus of Cisco, said the perfect storm is brewing with a rapidly accelerating India-US partnership, rapid advances in AI and steady leadership that will propel India as the world's second largest economy in three to four decades and the largest by the end of the century. "In his first 5 years in office he laid the ground for the next five. In the next five years in office he laid the ground for the next 25 years. I think this five is about laying the framework of the century. This is India's century," Chambers said in an interview with ET at the sidelines of the INDUS X summit that promotes joint defence innovation. He added that the third term sends a message of predictability and safety of investments into India. "The perfect storm in a positive way is about to happen and that perfect storm will be enabled by AI, and people have just begun to scratch the surface of what it means. We're just getting started," he said, adding that the US partnership adds 2% to the Indian GDP while India can add 1% to the GDP of the largest economy in the world. Chambers said no matter who wins the upcoming Presidential elections, the India-US relationship will not see any dramatic change. Describing India as the best place to be invested in the entire world, Chambers said that his prediction is that by the end of the century, the Indian economy will be 90-100% larger than China and perhaps 30-40% bigger than the US. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}

content: Deloitte has won the mandate for resolution of Jaiprakash Associates- the largest insolvency case currently, which has claims of over Rs 51509 crore and assets ranging from real estate to cement business, said a stock exchange disclosure. Deloitte will replace PwC for the sale process of Jaiprakash Associates , which is undergoing corporate insolvency and resolution process. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} Lenders had appointed Bhuvan Madan as the resolution professional. Going forward, Deloitte will support the RP, thus replacing PwC, said people with knowledge. Lenders have also approved a resolution to appoint legal firm Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas as legal advisor for the RP, and BDO LLP is appointed to carry out agency for specialised monitoring related assignments for the company. State Bank of India , ICICI Bank and IDBI Bank State Bank of India , ICICI Bank and IDBI Bank jointly hold little less than 60% debt in the company among 31 lenders. Manoj Gaur promoted Jaiprakash Associates was admitted in July after a six-year delay. JAL 's assets include operating cement plants with capacity of over 9 million tonnes; real estate around the Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Area ; hotels in Delhi, Noida, Mussoorie and Agra; EPC business, power plants, a hospital in Noida and also the Buddh International Circuit—the only Formula One track in India. content: BENGALURU: The market size of India's global capability centres is likely to grow to $99 billion-$105 billion by 2030 from $64.6 billion in fiscal 2024, according to a report by IT industry body Nasscom and consulting firm Zinnov released on Wednesday. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;} India's GCCs have evolved from low-cost outsourcing hubs to local offices of global companies supporting their parent organisations in multiple functions, including daily operations, finance, research and development. This has encouraged more multinational companies to set up local offices and boost hiring, a trend that is expected to grow exponentially in the coming years. U.S energy firm Chevron and French pharma company Sanofi recently committed around $1.4 billion cumulatively to set up or expand their GCCs. The report estimates the number of companies with GCCs in India to grow to around 2,100-2,200 by 2030, employing 2.5 million to 2.8 million people. The growth has been driven by the scale and quality of the talent pool, given India's status as one of the oldest offshoring ecosystems globally, said Namita Adavi, partner of the India GCC Consulting Practice at Zinnov. This has "created a flywheel effect in terms of the talent that is being churned out." Adavi expects the growth to come from sectors such as retail, healthcare and pharma, among others. Currently, software and internet, and the banking, financial services, and insurance segments have the biggest presence in the country. Leadership roles based in India are also expected to balloon to more than 30,000 by 2023, from the current 6,500, the report said. #sr_widget.onDemand p, #stock_pro.onDemand p{font-size: 14px;line-height: 1.28;} .onDemand .live_stock{left:17px;padding:1px 3px 1px 5px;font-size:12px;font-weight:600;line-height:18px;top:9px} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{margin:0 auto 0;} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc{color: #024d99;margin-top:10px;} #sr_widget.onDemand .crypto .live_stock .lb-icon{8px 6px 5px 3px !important} #sr_widget.crypto.onDemand a.text{border-bottom:1px solid #ccc;padding-bottom:5px;display:block;width:100%} #sr_widget.onDemand .sr_desc .text p, #stock_pro.onDemand .sr_desc .text p{font-size:12px;font-weight:400;}
